Job_Title: Planning & Reporting Analyst - ASEAN South Pacific
Job_Descriptions: This position manages reporting, planning, budgeting and forecasting (RPBF) and other financial analysis. Location: ASEAN-Flexible/India KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: Prioritized Responsibilities Prepare and update Actual prelim working file in order to be used for monitoring actual closing Prepare Quarterly Earnings Release: Volume, NSR and PBT Support consolidation of actual P&L, actual variance analysis and narratives Support financial consolidation to ensure accuracy and on time submission including R&O, Outlook, PMO and Roll Forward Prepare stocking-destocking report Develop monthly automated financial scorecard Support preparation of BP and SBP presentation for OUs Prepare monthly NSR/COGS variance analysis by quarter, by brand/category, by country Support on ad hoc financial analysis and request during RE/BP cycle Support on adhoc financial presentation COMMUNICATION COMPLEXITIES: Communicate, collaborate and interact with: Functional Manager Regions RFM Region Planning teams CPS APAC OUs ANALYSIS: The job involves analysis and scenario-planning skills Clearly communicate and translate into business-terms financial concepts in order to make sound business-decisions Ability to improve reporting and planning process to be more efficient JUDGMENT AND DECISION MAKING: Provide recommendation to improve work process Collaborate with Region planning teams Share best practices to planning teams QUALIFICATIONS / COMPENTENCIES / SKILLS: The ability to apply forecasting techniques and skills to support Region planning The ability to apply the system knowledge to improve reporting process/model Foundational competencies Accepting and building accountability Communicating effectively Planning and organizing Thinking systematically Acting with Integrity Technical skills Budgeting, planning and forecasting skills with attention to detail Problem Analysis and Problem Solving Financial Policies & Procedures Skills Budgeting; Management Reporting; Service Delivery; Strategic Planning Our Purpose and Growth Culture: We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. See yourself at Twilio Join the team as our next Principal Solutions Engineer RoA Who we are & why we’re hiring Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences. Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth momentum. About the job Twilio is enabling our customers to build the future of communications. The Solutions Engineering team is an important part of the sales team that is facilitating this communication renaissance. The Solutions Engineer is responsible for delivering the technical win and product fit for customer accounts. They build customer trust in Twilio solutions, which results in customer success in the post-sale. This is done by owning the technical pre-sales relationship, proposing technical architectures, demonstrating the product, anticipating concerns, and offering creative solutions. This role also involves working with our product teams as well, to be the voice of the customer and help to shape and direct our product roadmaps. The Solutions Engineer is both technical and a skilled relationship builder. They are comfortable showing an engaging communications experience to a CEO or sketching out an API flow on a whiteboard with customer software engineers. Only when safe to do so, you would be traveling at least 25% per month for this role visiting customers onsite. Responsibilities Twilio Solutions Engineers get to live our values every day. DRAW THE OWL: Build and present product demos to help showcase what a Twilio product can do. Assist customers with Pilot and Proof-of-Concept implementations DON'T SETTLE: Continuously learn new products and new technologies. Build trusted advisor relationships with customers WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES: Form a deep understanding of customer businesses and their problems. Work on RFPs / customer’s technical requirements with the Sales team EMPOWER OTHERS: Work alongside Twilio Account Executives through the pre-sales process, to strategize and plan for deal success. Educate and mentor customers, partners, and colleagues on what’s possible with Twilio BE BOLD: Present creative new solutions that enable and inspire innovation. Build demos and proof of concepts to demonstrate various use cases for Twilio's APIs WRITE IT DOWN: Create technical content to show customers how to implement specific use cases or best practices for new technologies. Distill and communicate customer needs and product feedback to Product Management, Engineering, Marketing and Sales Qualifications Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table! Twilio is looking for a professional who, regardless of their previous roles, has a desire to work in technical pre-sales and lives the Twilio Magic. As a pre-sales Solutions Engineer, you are not expected to be writing production code but being able to develop proof of concepts and understand questions from a developer audience is a requirement of the role. As such it is important that you have a good understanding of programming principles in order to enjoy and flourish in this role. Here are the key characteristics we are looking for in our candidates 8+ years pre-sales experience selling technical products or as a software developer working directly with customers. Able to build a deep understanding of a customer’s needs and guide them to a technical solution A creative problem solver with know how to get things done and collaborates with others to drive success An engaging communicator and presenter able to gain audience confidence Experience in one of the following areas, multiple areas of experience would be advantageous: Backend (Java, C#, Node.js, Python, PHP) Web development (JavaScript, frontend frameworks - React, Vue.js, Angular) Experience building with REST APIs Familiarity with cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure) and cloud application architecture. Previous experience in Telecommunications, SIP, or Contact Center is a plus. Location This role will be based in our beautiful Singapore office at Marina One. You will enjoy our incredible perks: snacks, weekly team lunch, daily community events, vibrant co-working space filled with multinational companies / startups / entrepreneurs / freelancers, and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook. What We Offer There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location. Twilio thinks big. Do you? We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values — something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts. So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now! If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions. Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa / travel restrictions in effect, we may only be extending offers to individuals who (a) are currently physically resident in Singapore, (b) have a legal right to work in Singapore, or (c) candidates who can start in this location by the expected hire date. We're keeping the situation under review and will adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on. Additionally, Twilio will require evidence of vaccination, medical ineligibility for vaccination or recovery from Covid-19 within the past 180 days, for employees going into the office as employees will not be able to access our offices from 15 January 2022 (unless such employee will complete the vaccination by 31 January 2022) without vaccination.  In accordance with applicable law, we may also collect evidence of vaccination as a condition of employment for employees who require work passes as of 1 February 2022.

Job_Title: Senior Regional Legal Counsel , Asia Pacific
Job_Descriptions: Entity: Allianz SE Singapore Branch (Allianz Asia Pacific) Job Purpose: Reporting to the Regional Chief Legal Officer, Asia Pacific, the candidate will be primarily responsible for managing all legal related aspects of M&A transactions in the Asia Pacific region. The candidate will also handle all legal issues and related matters, in addition to giving advice and guidance in legal matters to the respective OEs in the region in order to reduce legal risks. Key Responsibilities: Lead responsibility for the provision of legal and regulatory advice and transaction support on M&A and joint venture transactions in the Asia Pacific region, including regional partnerships, strategic corporate transactions and similar matters (with support from external legal counsel as applicable).  Such responsibilities include advising on deal structuring, identifying and addressing legal risks, negotiating with counterparties, leading the review transaction documents and managing external counsel, etc. Advising AZAP (Allianz Asia Pacific) senior management and OE (Operating Entities) CEOs and working closing with Group Legal on legal risks relating to such matters. Provide support on drafting, reviewing, amending and updating of agreements and other documents. Supervise and monitor corporate governance of OEs in the proper handling of board and shareholders’ meetings in compliance with applicable legal and regulatory requirements. Supervise and monitor implementation of OEs in relation to legal aspects of Group projects and initiatives. Oversee and lead legal aspects of regional projects and supervising OE’s local legal teams in relation to such regional projects, in alignment of the Group / Regional strategic direction. Responsible for engagement of external legal counsel, and ensuring quality of services and cost implications of such engagements. Key Requirements: Technical skills: Strong M&A experience and proven track-record of executing M&A transactions across the Asia Pacific region. Sound experience working on commercial contract negotiation and management and must have demonstrated corporate law and corporate governance experience. Strong legal drafting skills with high attention to detail. General skills: Self-motivated and have ability to work independently. Strong analytical, thinking and implementation skills and ability to problem-solve and provide pragmatic solutions. Strong communication skills and ability to interact with business leaders and manage a team effectively. Ability to multitask and handle multiple deals / timelines. Required experience: Direct deal experience performing due diligence, drafting, negotiating transaction documents, coordinating across-functional deal teams. Experience reviewing, drafting and negotiating complex legal agreements. Experience working internationally across multiple jurisdictions, particularly in the Asia Pacific region. M&A experience in the financial services industry and bancassurance arrangements in Asia Pacific Fluent verbal and written English and second Asian language (Mandarin strongly preferred). Proven team player and ability to establish and maintain working relationships with colleagues from different backgrounds, functions and cultures. Law degree (LLB) or equivalent 6 to 8 years post qualification experience as private practice attorney or in-house counsel with a multi-national corporation Employees are at the heart of Allianz, as a part of the New Ways of Work (WOW), Allianz has Globally adopted a Hybrid work model. This model offers the best of both the physical and digital work environments to all our employees, we are pleased to share that this role is Hybrid. Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow. Note: Diversity of minds is an integral part of Allianz’ company culture. One means to achieve diverse teams is a regular rotation of Allianz Executive employees across functions, Allianz entities and geographies. Therefore, the company encourages its employees to have motivation in gaining varied skills from different positions and to collect experiences from across Allianz Group.

Company description: About us Dyson Singapore is looking for an extraordinary Global Refurbishment Demand Planner to be based in our Technology Centre in Singapore. Job description: About the role Reporting into the Global Spares & Accessories Planning Manager, the Global Refurbishment Demand Planner will have responsibility for the demand planning of all spares & accessories that is required to support the refurbishment business for multiple markets and regions. The individual will be responsible for ensuring final demand signal is as accurate as possible. Working closely with multiple stakeholders in providing the necessary reporting of material planning and part availability. The ideal candidate has excellent analytical skills, a passion for demand planning and experience within (supply chain) planning environment. Detailed Responsibilities: Work collaboratively with individual market teams & refurb service provider in understanding the respective refurbishment businesses and full process flow Review, recommend and set up a systematic refurbishment demand planning process to ensure it is optimized to facilitate operational adherence and meet organization priorities Liaise with cross-functional teams to establish a flywheel of accurate and complete master data such as but not limited to returns rate and usage rate that is critical to the foundation of refurbishment demand planning Analyse refurbishment forecast errors, perform root-cause analysis and continue improvements to the forecast Keep up to date and adhere to any changes of the various macro/micro factors that influence the refurbishment demand planning process such as but not limited to sales strategy, competency level of the operational crew, plant capacity, quality, and part availability Identify, report and follow up on key risks and opportunities to maximize operational efficiency What we offer: Benefits Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you'll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it's an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition. #LI-DYSON Required profile: About you A minimum bachelor's degree is required A proven track record with at least 3 years of relevant experience Strong analytical ability Experience in demand planning Experience in running/supporting refurbishment operations or other operations of similar nature is preferred Demonstrate flexibility and resilience and respond constructively to new demands and challenges Displaying proactiveness and tenacity in resolving issues Strong interpersonal and communication skills Proven ability to develop and present KPI information Preferable SAP and/or Kinaxis user experience

Location: Jtc Launchpad @ One-North, Queenstown, Singapore, Central Region
Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022 Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Job_Title: Sr. Product Manager, Workplace Solutions - AP Region
Job_Descriptions: Why Work at Lenovo Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive. And we go big. No, not big—huge. We’re a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company serving customers in 180 markets around the world. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that power (through devices and infrastructure) and empower (through solutions, services and software) millions of customers every day and together create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society for everyone, everywhere. The one thing that’s missing? Well… you... Description and Requirements Sr. Product Manager, Workplace Solutions - AP Region Banding and Location: Band: 9 Location: Lenovo HK, Lenovo AU, Lenovo Singapore Language: Fluent in English, Other AP languages or Chinese huge plus Travel: up to 10% xxxxx – Sr. Product Manager Description: The Workplace Solutions Sr. Product Manager will be tasked with driving the Workplace Solutions business in Asia Pacific as the local lead product manager and a subject matter expert (SME) for workplace and building technology solutions.   They will work closely with Lenovo regional sales teams, solution architects, business partners, and customers to determine solution requirements and define offerings.  They will educate and promote Lenovo Workplace solutions to Lenovo GTM teams, training them on product value propositions, selling strategies, applications and pricing strategies.   The Workplace Solutions Sr. Product Manager will also leverage their industry knowledge and customer insights to provide requirements and guidance to the Lenovo portfolio, service, and engineering teams to enhance Lenovo’s offerings. Role Capabilities: This role requires a blend of domain expertise in workplace technology solutions as well as product management skills.  The ideal candidate will have prior technical and commercial knowledge of several workplace/building/real estate technologies and services such as workspace booking software, building management systems (BMS), digital signage, occupancy analytics, collaboration solutions, commercial AV, or IoT solutions.    The candidate should possess persuasive presentation and excellent communications skills as well as exceptional relationship management skills as they will be working directly with sales teams and key strategic partners. Role Requirements: 3+ Years Product Management experience, ideally with SaaS components 2+ Years Workplace or Smart Building industry experience (CRE/Smart Building/Commercial AV/ Collaboration, etc.) 2+ years in sales, technical, business development, marketing, or product management A passion for engaging, listening to, and learning from others

At Jabil we strive to make ANYTHING POSSIBLE and EVERYTHING BETTER. With over 260,000 diverse, talented and dedicated employees across 100 locations in 30 countries, our vision is to be the most technologically advanced and trusted manufacturing solutions provider. We combine an unmatched breadth and depth of end-market experience, technical and design capabilities, manufacturing know-how, supply chain insights and global product management expertise to enable success for the world’s leading brands. We are driven by a common purpose to make a positive impact for each other, our communities, and the environment. JOB SUMMARY Responsible for managing MRP to ensure that materials supply equals demand and to support optimization of overall cost of materials. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ·         Develop supply base and Supply Chain strategies that are unique to customer or for Business Unit Strategic materials. ·         Support customer’s business needs using standard process where possible and customized solutions where necessary. Collaborate with Purchasing manager and SCM to determine the best approach to meet the customer needs. Influence customer’s supply chain strategies to leverage those of Jabil. ·         Communicate Jabil expectations to the suppliers. Conduct supplier audit / visits, certifications, and performance reviews to develop and continuously improve supply base. Obtain feedback from Materials Planners on suppliers’ delivery, quality, and service performance. ·         Support, execute, and provide inputs to improve Jabil SCM initiatives and strategies. ·         Quote new and existing materials. Work with Materials Quotation Analyst if applicable. Frequently re-quote and negotiate to capitalize on cost reduction opportunities. ·         Make sourcing decisions based on overall cost and benefit including price, duty, freight, flexibility, service, performance, quality, and terms & conditions. ·         Negotiate terms and conditions that protect the best interest of Jabil and its customers. Negotiate liability terms, special stocking arrangements, and other agreements that are outside of standard Jabil terms and conditions. ·         Ensure execution of Jabil pricing and terms & conditions agreements such as World Wide Purchasing Agreements that are negotiated and agreed to by Jabil. ·         Improve sourcing options by working with Jabil’s internal resources and customers to add Jabil preferred and/or strategic suppliers to customer’s Approved Manufacturer’s List (AML). ·         Analyze and project component purchase prices that accurately reflect the inventory value for a financial period in Standard Costing process. ·         Provide input to determine Quoted Cost to the Customer that is competitive yet maximizes the amount of Materials Price Variance (MPV). ·         Continuously optimize MPV by reducing the cost of materials and by limiting unfavorable PPV/MPV. Work with BUM to obtain customers’ authorization for additional expenses such as premiums on materials or freight and tooling charges incurred on customers’ behalf. ·         Collaborate with Materials Planners and monitor, track, and provide feedback on suppliers’ performance for continuous improvement. ·         Work with Materials Planners to ensure that suppliers support overall business needs of Jabil. ·         Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor. ·         Comply and follow all procedures within the company security policy. ·         May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned. JOB QUALIFICATIONS KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS ·         Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. ·         Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. ·         Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. ·         Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. ·         Ability to operate a personal computer including using a Windows based operating system and related software. ·         Advanced PC skills, including training and knowledge of Jabil’s software packages. ·         Ability to write simple correspondence. Read and understand visual aid. ·         Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out simple one- or two-step instructions. ·         Ability to deal with standardized situations with only occasional or no variables. ·         Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. ·         Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. ·         Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret graphs. Jabil, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Founded in 1913 in Italy, the Prada Group was built on a tradition of excellence and with a vision of innovation. The Group, a world leader in the luxury sector, operates in more than 45 countries with the PRADA, Miu Miu, Church’s and Car Shoe brands, and has employees of over 100 nationalities. The acquisition of Pasticceria Marchesi 1824 has marked the Group’s entry into the food sector, applying the same high quality criteria. Very proactive also in the art field, the Prada Group strengthens its presence through contemporary art projects in constant evolution. Joining our Company means working in a creative and international environment, with teams of people motivated by curiosity and the quest for excellence. The engine of our success is the importance and value that we place on the talent and passion of our people leading to their own professional growth. JOB PURPOSE To be the “ambassador” who conveys the Brand’s philosophy and values. As such, to be responsible to maximize the sales performance by fostering the relationship with the customers and developing their Brand loyalty, providing a unique experience in our store and guiding the client into our world. RESPONSIBILITIES Welcome and serve the customer providing an excellent in-store experience at all times. Maintain and develop client relationships through an individual approach, leveraging also on CRM and digital tools. Be proactively engaged in cross selling with all Departments and maximizes sales opportunity in order to achieve individual sales target and KPIs. Ensure to be up-to-date knowing fashion trends and competitors. Prove Brand and product knowledge. Deal effectively with customer complaints by liaising with the line manager when necessary. The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems specialises in collecting, managing and exploiting information to reveal actionable intelligence. We use this capability to help government and commercial clients reveal intelligence, maintain security and strengthen resilience in today’s complex operating environment. We also use our skills to assist clients with other information-intensive problems such as achieving regulatory compliance and understanding customer behaviour. We help nations, governments and businesses around the world defend themselves against cybercrime, reduce their risk in the connected world, comply with regulation, and transform their operations. We do this using our unique set of solutions, systems, experience and processes - often collecting and analysing huge volumes of data. We employ over 4,000 people across 18 countries in the Americas, APAC, UK and EMEA. You will be involved in the Planning, Monitoring and Control (PM&C) Professional is to set up, operate and assure the processes directly associated with the 7 core competencies of PM&C: Estimating Work content and scope Time scheduling and phasing Budgeting and Cost Management Earned Value Management Managerial Analysis Change Management The PM&C Professional may also set up, operate and assure aspects of Project Management Integration such as Risk & Opportunity Management You will provide direct support to Portfolio, Programme and Project Managers, and Service Delivery Managers, as required within the framework of the local Programme Management Office Key Responsibilities: Contribute to a culture of delivery excellence across the delivery community Act as a source of best practice guidance on project management processes relating to project set up, overall and specific control during execution and close down activities Undertake the common  administrative and management support  activities for projects, programmes and portfolios Produce management information, including scenario modelling, in direct support of analysis of a project, programme or portfolio’s health Support delivery governance and reporting requirements Generalised support to portfolios, programmes and projects as set by local PMO conditions Support monthly governance processes Complete project set up and close down tasks Support monthly finance activities You will be expected to have an awareness of the project management lifecycle and associated support duties and work independently in the application of these activities across portfolios, programmes and projects which  consist of the below: Comprehensive support to portfolios, programmes and projects as set by local PMO conditions Facilitation of monthly governance processes Complete project set up and close down tasks Management of monthly project finance activities Provide training and guidance to Trainees Singapore Government G-50 security clearance. Company Information The Applied Intelligence business of BAE Systems delivers solutions which help to protect and enhance the connected world. Our solutions combine large scale data exploitation, ‘intelligencegrade’ security and complex services and solutions integration. We operate in four key domains of expertise: Cyber Security, Financial Crime, Communications Intelligence and Digital Transformation. Today, we have staff across the UK and Europe, the Americas, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our people apply intelligence to protect and enhance national and organisational assets so that they can grow and prosper – from improving the health and efficiency of leading corporations to protecting critical infrastructures, safeguarding vulnerable people and catching criminals. Together, we make the world a safer place. Make everyday matter. Life at BAE Systems Applied Intelligence We are embracing Hybrid Working. This means you and your colleagues may be working in different locations, such as from home, another BAE Systems office or client site, some or all of the time, and work might be going on at different times of the day. By embracing technology, we can interact, collaborate and create together, even when we’re working remotely from one another. Hybrid Working allows for increased flexibility in when and where we work, helping us to balance our work and personal life more effectively, and enhance wellbeing. Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence We use our intelligence-led insights to help defend Governments, Nations and Societies from cyber-attacks and financial crime. Our customers depend on our evolving capabilities to help them safely grow their organisations. Our unprecedented access to threat intelligence, world-leading analysts and market-leading technology means we can help them to adapt, evolve and stay ahead of the criminals. Division overview: Government At BAE Systems Applied Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Government contracts are an area we have many decades of experience in. Our Government business unit houses four of our critical client groups: UK National Security, Global National Security, defence and central government. Government and key infrastructure networks are critical targets to defend as the effects of these networks being breached can be devastating. As a member of the Government business unit, you will defend the connected world and ensure the protection of nations. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.

Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors where restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers. No visit to Singapore is complete without a stay here, where the grand historic hotel exudes old-world grandeur infused with the unique charm of the city state. Guests can experience the modern comfort and amenities presented within 115 luxuriously spacious suites complemented by our legendary 24-hour Raffles Butler Service and a heritage tour of the property by our Resident Historian. 10 restaurants and bars present both local favourites, fine dining and collaborations with internationally renowned chefs and curated classics such as the iconic Singapore Sling experience and classic Raffles Afternoon Tea amidst the colonial charm of the historic Grand Lobby. A rooftop swimming pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city while the new Raffles Spa is a holistic sanctuary offering pampering spa experiences and renewed well-being. Guests are also invited to visit the Raffles Boutique to shop for gourmet gifts and heritage-inspired souvenirs and a revitalized Raffles Arcade showcasing an elegant mix of new-to-market, and world-renowned international brands, collectively creating a one-of-a-kind retail experience that goes beyond traditional brick and mortar shopping. Official website URL: www.rafflessingapore.com Job Purpose The position is responsible for delivering friendly and efficient wine service that meets guest dining experience expectations.

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2020, Continental generated sales of €37.7 billion and currently employs around 233,000 people in 58 countries and markets. In 2021, the company celebrates its 150th anniversary. The Vehicle Networking and Information business area, with its vision of “Always On,” sees the vehicle of the future as a partner that supports its passengers with intelligent and secure solutions – seamlessly networked, user-friendly, convenient and smart. The business area develops and integrates components and end-to-end systems for connected mobility – architecture, hardware, software and services. With solutions for networking, human-machine interaction, user experience, high-performance computing, digital services and system integration for passenger cars, light commercial vehicles and fleets, Vehicle Networking and Information ensures stable and safe connectivity and smooth information flows for connected mobility.

Job Description : We are searching for a passionate and experienced Deputy Director of Marketing Communications. You will be responsible for shaping and evolving SIMTech & ARTC’s (S&A) creative and content strategy to strengthen S&A brand identity and ensuring consistency of all brand communication across all traditional and digital touch-points. You will help enhance S&A brand equity through clear and impactful brand communication and events across the two research institutes as part of the overall marketing communications and brand plans. You are expected to drive, oversee, and develop our branding strategy and activities across S&A, owning and managing our digital brand experience including brand creatives, influencer marketing and social media strategies. Responsibilities: Branding & Content Shape and evolve S&A’s creative and content strategy and deploy our brand story in a way which establishes strong emotional connections and resonates to our customers and members in the manufacturing sector. Developing communication themes that will hold the storytelling together, creative style guides, guidelines, vision, mission and value proposition for short as well as long term. Be the lead for innovative branding activities and events, leading a team of creative and highly experienced brand marketers and social media enthusiasts across S&A. Manage and strengthen S&A’s network of industry and public agency relationships by supporting the development of breakthrough content for S&A across earned and owned media channels. Play a central role in bringing our marketing communications strategy to life and manage the content production teams across S&A. Work closely with content & digital marketing, creative, researchers, industry development office, and Corporate Communications teams to develop and implement brand events and campaigns to amplify marketing initiatives in earned and owned media channels, playing an active role in the brand planning process. Act as the expert advisor to the broader S&A teams providing direction for content development across channels and measuring the impact of the campaigns via social listening and audience engagement. Lead offline and online brand and marketing events end-to-end and support the teams across S&A in the execution. Strengthen and expand on S&A’s wide network of influencers and continuously evolve the influencer marketing strategy to adapt to market trends. Management & Reporting Drive and own brand-marketing related discussions and forums, and reporting on marketing’s impact to key stakeholders, with actionable insights. Lead, develop and advise a small team of highly experienced content and digital marketers, events marketing and creatives across S&A. Manage Budget, strategize team’s development, including training and succession planning, and any Ad-hoc project assigned Source, evaluate and collaborate with external agencies for content production and branding strategy. Measure the effectiveness of existing brand and social channels – developing the channel framework, reflecting latest trends and technologies to ensure we are best in class. Review branding initiatives and social content calendars to ensure alignment with S&A positioning and mitigate reputational risk. Work with the A*STAR Corporate Communications team in rolling out positioning initiatives and public relations and media marketing. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Marketing, Brand Management, Business, PR or related fields 10 -15 years of relevant work experience in brand marketing and/or experience managing PR, creative production, and digital media customer engagement programmes for a brand—preferably in the FMCG, B2C, and B2B space. Strong business acumen Experience as people manager and in managing a team of marketers Experience in developing and evaluating the effectiveness of 360 degree media plans Excellent writing and communication skills Deep understanding for creative production and brand visuals Experience in TV, live-streaming, or Digital production is a plus Digitally savvy with a passion for the digital landscape and knowledge of how platforms work, with experience in social listening and data analytics Experience in managing events end-to-end Agile and able to adapt quickly. Can operate in a high-growth business where change is constant, and flexibility is key to ensure success for the greater team The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Technical Specialist - Mechanical (Medical Device MNC / Office Hours)
Job_Descriptions: Who We Are BD is a leading global medical technology company that creates medical technology, devices and laboratory equipment for a variety of needs across the healthcare sector. At BD, we are looking for candidates who possess passion, innovative solutions and a commitment to our one mission of improving access to groundbreaking medical and biotechnology services for people near and far, delivering state-of-the-art technology and cutting-edge research in the battle to fight and cure infectious diseases. With a global reach that extends across 50 countries worldwide, our network of professionals collaborates on effective measures to deliver enhanced patient quality such as lower health care delivery costs, improved health care and safety, and expanded health care for all. Join our company and see how you can become a part of one global mission to make a difference in human health. Purpose: You will provide technical expertise to support manufacturing in leading machine enhancement, managing preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, repair and maintenance of machines, project execution, accountability on production waste and quality of all machine tools operations and the overall technician resource management in production. This is a new headcount, permanent position to support our engineering and production needs for our new production line. You will be required to work 12 hours day shift and the shift pattern is 3/4/4/3. Job Responsibilities: Maintain machines to meet production output, and other metrics like quality, waste etc. Perform Preventive Maintenance (Cleaning, Service, Replace) Perform troubleshooting of machine and tools, equipment failures to meet production targets, safety and quality standards and/or specifications Perform product/machine changeover on the line by tool/die change and machine set-up Initiate, Implement and follow-up on machine enhancement and project assignments Write Standard Work Instruction / Procedure for assigned operation / process Implement Corrective and Preventives Actions Participate in training and coaching of Technicians and new hires on skills and knowledge on machine operations and adjustments Assist Engineers or Subject Matter Experts for any CI activities. Our Requirements: Nitec/Higher Nitec or Diploma in any Engineering discipline with some experience in a manufacturing environment. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. You will be required to work 12 hours day shift and the shift pattern is 3/4/4/3. Familiar with assembly lines automation. Experience working with Programmable Logic Controllers (e.g. Omron or Allen Bradley) is an advantage. Ability to interpret pneumatic diagrams. Ability to carry out troubleshooting for machineries issues related to electrical, electronic components or pneumatic components. Sound knowledge and understanding of various types of sensors (reflective, proximity etc.) and switches for assembly lines application. Basic understanding of machining or fabrication techniques for mechanical parts. Ability to interpret mechanical parts drawing. Culture and Benefits Here at BD, we embrace a growth mindset, building capabilities for the future and helping you become the best version of yourself. We offer our employees a clear direction and career pathway for development. We pride ourselves on our transparent and rigorous talent processes that are inclusive, deeply embedded in trust, aligned with our culture, and enable us to achieve strategic imperatives of the organization. Our leaders are committed, engaged and accountable to making talent our top priority. How To Apply Submit your application by clicking on the “apply” button at the top of the page. Job_Descriptions: Credit Portfolio Group (CPG) Lending is one of the key sub-groups within Banking and is mandated to actively manage the Corporate and Investment Bank's retained credit exposures resulting from traditional lending. CPG is responsible for developing and executing strategies with the primary goals of reducing credit risk concentration and losses from credit events. The business can execute these objectives via a variety of methods including loan assignments, macro hedges and other bespoke derivative hedges. The Asia Lending Product Controller team are responsible for ensuring the overall integrity and validity of the financial statements and controls over the transaction cycle, performing critical reporting functions for the organization including financial and regulatory, product valuation, improving ongoing processes and ensuring execution and implementation of the overall financial architecture. to the following areas: • Assist with daily P&L reporting and month-end close processes including but not limited to review of financial data, investigating significant variances and transactions, fluctuation analysis, preparation of financial reporting deliverable, preparation of estimate accruals, perform reconciliations, general ledger substantiation etc. • Lead and manage all US external reporting impacting Lending and Trade & Working Capital business. • Responsible for the compilation of financial statements, footnotes, management’s discussion and analysis and all other components of the filings. • Ensure internal control procures are in place and maintain SOX compliance. • Ensure financial information is in compliance with US & local GAAP and firm’s corporate accounting policies, documenting exceptions where appropriate • Partner with the business to drive forth and implement robust controls and new business initiatives • Drive coordination across various front & back office support functions to ensure resolution of control and reporting issues in an accurate and timely manner • Driving change and improvement in process in order to improve transparency and efficiency in month-end results. • Serve as an analytical and project support resource for product control • Handle various ad-hoc requests on a daily basis • Engage in New Business Initiatives and provide inputs related to accounting and booking issues. • Establish and maintain strong working relationship with various stakeholders (e.g. Front office Traders/Portfolio manager, Legal entity controller, Credit risk, Loan operations, Global controller team, Planning & Analysis group etc.) Requirements : • Minimum of 5 years of experience in accounting or external audit in the financial services industry • • Proven skills in identifying and resolving control issues that may impact financial results • Experience reviewing/creating complex operational and general ledger process flows • Excellent communication skills and executive presence including the ability to present complex and sensitive matters • Strong interpersonal, communication and team-building skills • Ability to manage several projects and tasks concurrently • Ability to evaluate the design and effectiveness of internal financial controls • Advanced MS Excel skills and MS PowerPoint skills are essential • Team player and ability to work closely with global team members and other groups in the organization. • Good knowledge of SAP ledger system is preferred • Good knowledge of Lending products (loans and derivatives) Job_Title: Wealth Management - Business Analysis Associate I - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Business Overview J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, with client assets of $2.4 trillion, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits. Operations Overview Operations are uniquely positioned at the heart of all that we do. We impact the business we undertake from end to end – involved in almost all major steps of the transaction lifecycle as well as new initiatives (account opening and KYC, products and services) and vendor management. We work in collaboration with counterparts from all areas across Lines of Business, Technology, Finance and Corporate Functions. Our role is all about maintaining the efficient processes our people rely on every day to do first-class business, whilst constantly striving to achieve the improvement that makes the firm one of the most respected financial institutions in the world. The global focus on Anti Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Client (KYC) is increasing and leading to new roles and opportunities within JP Morgan. The firm is establishing within Operations a market-leading function to help manage the client onboarding transformation whilst meeting regulatory risks involved in Onboarding clients. We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and growing team in a fast paced and challenging area. Key Responsibilities: The Client Onboarding Business Analytics & Reporting role is part of the IPB Business Enablement Team and will report to the Business Analytics and Transformation Manager. The role will provide reporting and data analytic services to the Client Ops organization. It will work closely with the wider team to support the delivery of a transformed client experience that is cost effective for the business. Focus areas include owning BaU MIS provision and leading initiatives that enable more efficient and sustainable MIS provision to support Client Operations and bring insights that will enable the transformation journey. • Support all aspects of management activities for Asia Business Enablement • Lead provision of BaU MIS to ensure teams have access to information they need • Support transformation of Asia wide MIS provision; leverage new tools and techniques to enable operational efficiencies, generate insights and adapt to strategic transformation agenda with transparent governance model • Support implementation projects from an Onboarding BAU perspective, • Ensure the team is supported to provide a detailed analysis and understanding of complex workflows and explaining them to colleagues across the business, and able to escalate appropriately any risks identified in business process • Ensure that all IPB site locations and groups that support IPB work to the same standard of efficiency and establish a best in class function • Support the preparation of presentations to Senior Management and various stakeholders of the Private Bank Qualifications: What do we look for? Candidates with relevant degree or relevant work experience in similar role • Maintains a sense of urgency and ability to prioritize/multi-task. • Minimum 3 years working experience including roles in AML/ KYC in the context of client onboarding and in a control function is preferred • The role will support projects and new processes within Client Onboarding therefore minimum 3 years previous experience of this type of work within a Client Onboarding environment is required • Strong Attention to detail, results oriented and delivery focused • Excellent Organizational skills • Strong written and oral communication skills, able to influence internal and external stakeholders • Strong analytical, prioritization and organizational skills • Minimum 3 years’ experience in Excel and data analytics • Minimum 1 years’ experience in Alteryx or similar ETL tools • Knowledge of data analysis and tools (e.g. Python, Hadoop) tool is an added advantages • Logical, structured approach to planning, problem solving and decision-making • Strong risk and controls awareness • Capacity to think laterally and convey an understanding of the big picture • Minimum Bachelor degree holder To apply for this position, please use the following URL: https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=83c89b1c24e09cab444467c7e40b04b2

Job_Descriptions: Who We Are BD is a leading global medical technology company that creates medical technology, devices and laboratory equipment for a variety of needs across the healthcare sector. At BD, we are looking for candidates who possess passion, innovative solutions and a commitment to our one mission of improving access to groundbreaking medical and biotechnology services for people near and far, delivering state-of-the-art technology and cutting-edge research in the battle to fight and cure infectious diseases. With a global reach that extends across 50 countries worldwide, our network of professionals collaborates on effective measures to deliver enhanced patient quality such as lower health care delivery costs, improved health care and safety, and expanded health care for all. Purpose: As Senior/Electrical Engineer, you are responsible to CEA1 product value stream for providing leadership in technical support in the areas of manufacturing, electrical/electronics engineering to the department to achieve targets for quality, output, waste, machine stoppages, machine efficiency & reliability and cost reduction activities. Job Responsibilities: Lead in investigate and analyze electronic and electrical problems relating to equipment, process and to recommend and ensure implementation of corrective actions. Identify opportunities for process, equipment enhancement, plan and implement activities to achieve objectives. Review preventive maintenance program, make changes where necessary and administer proper implementation to ensure smooth running of equipment to produce products within specifications efficiently. Lead and develop training programmes and conduct technical in-house training, including safety for Production Technicians, Electrical/Electronic Technical Specialists and Mechanical Technical Specialists to ensure they are qualified to carry out their assigned responsibilities. Participate actively in and contribute to Resource Team activities to meet overall departmental goals. Lead and facilitate Process Team members to develop into successful self-managing teams to achieve the performance indicators assigned to them. Use of Design of Engineering Experiments for evaluation of process problems and process capability studies. Control and manage the expense accounts assigned to ensure compliance to budget. Perform experimental testing to approve change of existing process and co-ordinate with relevant supporting services such as material, facilities, quality for implementation of project. Participate in cost reduction activities involving equipment modification/improvement. Manage all activities regarding electronic/electrical spare parts to ensure availability, timely and cost effective servicing of defective electrical/electronic equipment/components, liasing with local/overseas vendors on issues involving technical specifications, application, requirement, etc. Involve in write-up of specifications for new equipment and participate in the subsequent installation, debugging and commissioning to ensure the new equipment can achieve the performance levels as per the specifications. Establish and implement proper documentation for all electronic/electrical programming and circuits and ensure all documents are promptly and accurately updated to reflect changes. Participate or drive continuous improvement initiatives / activities. With mobility and cloud, devices and locations no longer matter, and the quality of the Cisco Collaboration experience helps people to achieve extraordinary things. Join a dynamic team that is driving growth and adoption of Cisco Collaboration solutions into the APJC market, leading the move to cloud and as a service models and disrupting traditional competing vendors in the space. Become part of the dynamic specialist sales team that owns and drives the product and solution strategy for Cisco Collaboration. Take control of the business, make an impact, and shape the market by engaging with our customers and inspiring the Cisco sales teams. What You’ll Do You will work with Collaboration sales team to manage and drive Collaboration Products and Solutions for the Enterprise, Public Sector and Commercial Select segments across APJC Be the acknowledged expert for driving larger, complex and cross architecture sales for hybrid work Be the expert in competitive intelligence providing updates to partners, Cisco sales teams and customers Drive increased awareness internally and externally of TCO analysis of various solutions Work as part of a team across product sales specialists, solution architects, partner teams and marketing Drive initiatives with our product engineering teams to increase coverage and success in APJC market Support creating regular business reviews, success matrix and reports tracking for theater sales and partner teams and other key functional groups to ensure GTM execution Who You Are Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally across various organizations to drive outcomes 10+ years sales experience selling to enterprise and public sector customers across APJC Ability to influence and lead in a highly matrixed model Excellent verbal communication, listening and presentation skills. Able to articulate complex ideas and strategies to people at all levels of the organization. Strong background and understanding of product, service, and channels sales at Cisco or comparable experience from another company Track record of successful performance as a “change agent” within Cisco or other companies Bachelor’s degree from a reputable university/college #WeAreCisco , where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re "old" (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Job Title: Assistant Head – Network Security Engineer Job Type: 3-year renewable contract Job Location: North, Singapore (This is an outsourced role). Our Client: It is a statutory board of the Singapore government, under the Ministry of Trade and Industry of Scope. The agency supports R&D that is aligned to areas of competitive advantage and national needs for Singapore. Job Responsibilities: The Network Security Engineer will support daily network security operations, implement solution in an enterprise network infrastructure and participate in network related audit activities. The Network Security Engineer will be involved in the full spectrum of project activities, involving technical design, conduct Proof-of-Concepts (POCs), project management, engineering & integration and acceptance testing & commissioning. Deploy, configure, monitor and manage of network / network security devices including but not limited to Next Gen Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Cisco ISE, VPNs, NACs and Firewall auditing tools and ensuring their smooth and reliable operation for fulfilling business objectives and processes. Provide 2nd level technical support, develop designs and customize solutions to meet business and/or users’ requirements. Fulfilling of network security related service request. Troubleshooting & resolving of network security issue(s) and incident(s). Promptly update of issue or incident tickets, inform/liaise with users and conduct necessary escalation to the relevant parties (management and/or external vendors) when necessary. Manage / Work with external vendors to resolve escalated isissues/incidents Managing of network / network security related projects to meet projects’ timelines and deliverables. Conducting of any software security and vulnerability patching on network security related devices. Participate / Support in network related audit(s), provision security audit artefacts and remediate audit findings within the stipulated timeline. After office hours’ support will be required at times especially during network planned/unplanned outages and maintenance. Collaborate with executive management and department leaders to assess near- and long-term network capacity needs. Create and maintain documentation of network configuration, network diagram, mapping, processes, and service records. Take initiative to proactively discover and remediate deficiencies in network solutions, both deployed and in the design phase. Participate and lead problem resolution and cause analysis. Drive efforts to restore, recover, or alter configurations, logical or physical, to maintain service integrity. Assist in developing, implementing, and maintaining policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery. Conduct research on network/network security products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the IT industry. Manage network assets, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information. Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports. Job Requirements: Relevant Diploma or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering (or equivalent). Network certification (CCNA/CCNP) is mandatory. Security certification (PCNSE/CCSA/NSE 4) will be an added advantage. At least 5 years of strong experience with in-depth hands-on in Next Generation Firewall (such as Cisco, Palo Alto, Check Point, Fortinet, etc.), IDS/IPS, NAC (Clearpass / ISE), VPN and Firewall Auditing tools (such as Algosec, Tufin, Firemon, etc). Knowledge on LAN, WAN & Wireless, switching & routing technologies (such as VLAN, STP, OSPF, BGP, etc.), MPLS, IPv6, Multicast, L3VPN, DNS/DHCP is required. Knowledge and experience on SDN, Cloud & Network Automation will be an added advantage. Strong communications and written skills. Excellent problem-solving skills in a multi-tasking, fast-paced and complex work environment. Ability to work as a team and independently with minimum supervision. If you are looking for an opportunity and your skills align with this job, please send your updated CV/resume (in Word format) to Mounika at *******@rmagroup.com.sg. All Curriculum Vitae will be treated with the strict confidentiality We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Overview Want a role where you can utilize your technical expertise and customer-facing skills in the dynamic tech industry? This position is your opportunity to succeed as a pre-sales professional, allowing you to work with state-of-the-art software offerings. We’ll provide you with continuous training and mentorship to help you on your way to success as a sales engineer. What will you be doing? Your job is to partner with our sales executives as the key technical lead throughout the pre-sales lifecycle of our business. Through this partnership, you will work in a consultative role to assist in the successful closing of new deals by performing demonstrations and pre-sales support to our prospective and returning customers. Your responsibilities will include: Presenting and demonstrating AvePoint’s product offerings relevant to customer objectives remotely and on-site. Communicating with prospective customers, assisting and guiding them through their evaluation and selection process. Building environments tailored to customer requirements as Proof of Concept during the sales lifecycle to illustrate product capabilities and how they align specifically with customer objectives. Participating in writing proposals in response to RFIs / RFPs that showcase how the AvePoint solutions can satisfy customer requirements with an attractive return on their investment. Acting as the customer advocate and liaison to the AvePoint product management and development teams. Helping the sales team identify and understand customer business objectives and organization to best align Microsoft and AvePoint technologies. Establishing relationships with key customer business and technical advocates that have the power to drive long-term Microsoft and AvePoint solution adoption within their company. Developing customers’ buying vision for how AvePoint can help them reduce costs and increase business agility. Supporting AvePoint Partner and Marketing teams with their field activities. What we look for: We look for people who value agility, passion, and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you. In this role, you’re tasked with serving as a key technical resource through the sales cycle. That means you’ll need to become an authority in the features and benefits of our software and services solutions to properly educate customers, gain consensus, and demonstrate value in solving their concerns with SharePoint and Office 365. Qualities you will need to be a fit for this role include: Bachelor’s Degree (Computer, Technology, and Engineering majors preferred) 3-5 years of relevant work experience Confident and enthusiastic presentation skills Advanced business and technical communication skills – can lead conversations to align technical value to client’s business needs Readiness to think strategically to help close deals using technical knowledge coupled with a sales mentality Ability to maintain excellent relationships with customers and colleagues Ability to work individually and within a highly collaborative team Willingness to learn and adapt in a dynamic and fast-changing environment Authoritative business analysis capabilities Advanced troubleshooting skills Technical Qualities: At least 3 years of experience with Microsoft SharePoint and Office 365 in solution design and implementation Working knowledge of Microsoft Cloud offerings such as Office 365, Dynamics 365, and Azure Understanding of Microsoft SharePoint architecture, components, and configuration, including the differences between versions and hybrid architectures Hands-on experience with plugins, workflows, and solutions on SharePoint .NET, C#, JavaScript programming experience preferred Comfortable with building PowerShell scripts to automate tasks. Experience in ITPro related topics such as server and software installation, configuration, and administration, especially for Windows Server, Microsoft SQL Server, and SharePoint Working knowledge of TCP/IP, DNS, Active Directory, SMTP, and DHCP technologies is a plus Broader knowledge of server and cloud offerings in the tech industry We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents. A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Job Summary Equinix, the world’s digital infrastructure company, relies on data-based insights to power decision-making process. As the central analytics organization at Equinix, the Data & Analytics (DNA) team is the master mind behind the company’s most strategic analytics initiatives that shape the trajectory of the entire organization. We are looking for a Senior Analytics Product Manager to drive the strategy and execution for Equinix’s cutting-edge, scalable analytics platform. You will be owning and delivering a persona-based analytics platform that consists of various dashboards, scorecards and self-service tools to serve a broad base of internal customers – all the way from financial analysts to the executive leadership. Showing us your love for dashboard solutions, business acumen, user experience and visualization! The ideal candidate for this role is creative, analytical, commands deep business acumen, understands user experience and is passionate about analytics. You will formulate analysis, lead product development, evangelize usage, and drive improvement for DNA’s analytics offerings. This role will allow you to combine your passion for business, analytics and user experience to develop a unique set of analytics products. Come join us if you are excited about building and owning an entire analytics ecosystem for a fast-growing company! Responsibilities Own Product Roadmap : Understand needs of business users to concretely define DNA product offerings in the development pipeline; drive product vision, strategies, and roadmaps Design Hypothesis-based Analytics : Breakdown complex issues, define concisely the critical business questions, and develop data-driven exploratory analysis to proactively answer the questions Lead Product Development : work with designers and data analysts to draft requirement documents and build prototypes; communicate and clarify feature requirements to the development team; lead user-testing to ensure product built per requirement Drive Continuous Improvement : Incorporate internal product requests, identify opportunities, drive prioritization, and manage backlogs to improve product functionality and user experience Realize Product Value : Develop release communication plans, identify early adopters, lead pilots to ensure rapid adoption of new platform offerings Qualifications 5+ years of product management experience, with consistent record of driving end-to-end product lifecycle at a large technology company Ability to showcase a portfolio of past products developed / owned Track record in developing reporting and analytics solutions from scratch, preferably under an enterprise environment Experience with UI/UX design and a solid understanding of self-service analytics and techniques
