About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Cloud allows us to be location-agnostic, ubiquitous, scalable according to needs. By embarking on a cloud-first strategy, we have the means to deliver our network, serve our customers, improve efficiencies and embrace new business opportunities through greater API connectivity. We target more than half of our compute workloads for core banking and trading systems, and new innovations, to be cloud-based by 2025, subject to regulatory approvals. All new systems are now built for the cloud, utilising modern compute paradigms and architectures that are container-based and service-based. We're looking for talented individuals in their early careers who are passionate about technology and customer experience, and we value specialised expertise. You’ll also be put through Standard Chartered’s Cloud Engineering Programme by aXess Academy. We have developed an exciting 5 weeks programme designed to fast track and enable you to build the skillsets necessary to be cloud-ready. This includes structured learning pathways in areas such as Agile, Cloud Computing, Cloud Services, Security, DevOps and Cloud Migration. You will follow a tailored training and development plan where you will have exposure to senior leaders and other technologists across the bank as well as learn more about Standard Chartered and how we operate, apply and adopt technologies with business. Post the Cloud Engineering Programme, your role responsibilities will cover: Implement a state-of-the-art platform to enable our customers to gain a faster time to market Be recognised as trusted partner for business application owners and other technology teams who seek to make use of Cloud based infrastructure Provide technical design expertise to application and delivery teams Introduce & support emerging technology and best market practices to ensure consistent and state of the art systems are built and business achieves enhanced benefits As a Cloud Engineer your role may vary depending upon the vertical you serve as: Cloud Security Engineer Systems Engineer (Cloud) Cloud Developer Cloud Architect Network Engineer (Cloud) Special responsibility for: Ensuring that platform conforms to Standard Chartered security best practises and is fully consistent with Bank audit and compliance requirements and fully consistent with the design ethos and technical requirements of external cloud providers Full-Stack development Software testing during deployment cycles Architectural design and continuous improvement of the platform adhering to regulator and compliance requirements Supporting adoption of containers and container control frameworks for external and internal Cloud Services, including container platform selection and design, cost and license planning and ensuring that self-service design/deployment/control web containers is appropriate for requirements Ensure lifecycle management consists of documentation such as test cases, source code repositories etc are actively used and maintained Perform other duties as assigned or required Our Ideal Candidate Studied Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant disciplines in software design and development or with coding knowledge. Should have some knowledge in Cloud Technologies. Advantages if you have Cloud certifications. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

Location: Funan, 107, North Bridge Road, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179105, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. This may be by referring new students, talking about our programs to people, or helping with getting advertising material out. You will also be required to do basic cash register activities selling uniforms, merchandise and events. You are also expected to interact with Paragon posts through social media and help share the message with your social circle. Expectations: The Instructor is expected at all times to: 1. Lead by example 2. Train minimum two times per week 3. Attend all instructor training sessions 4. Maintain excellent knowledge of the curriculum they have covered. 5. Be punctual on all commitments 6. Conduct themselves with a highly positive, energetic and contagious attitude 7. Be constantly adding value to the student experience 8. Raise the quality of instruction at Paragon Martial Arts 9. Be Punctual to all commitments 10. Maintain a high energy high expectations class. 11. Follow up with the manager or the family on any students missing class 12. Maintain student numbers in class 13. Bring in a minimum of 2 new students per month Characteristics and Skills Sets: 1. Strong and positive attitude 2. Hunger to learn 3. Energetic 4. Martial Arts Interest 5. Ability to interact and talk to children 6. Ability to interact and talk to families 7. Desire to do more than is expected 8. Strong teaching skills with a desire to continually learn how to improve 9. Ability to deliver the curriculum in an exciting manner Reporting Channel: The Instructor reports to the Director of ParagonInc Please apply now if you would like to be considered for the selection process. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Job_Descriptions: THK Therapy Service Division (TS) provides occupational therapy, physiotherapy and speech language therapy services to THKMC programmes and other community organisations. Job_Title: QA Technical Specialist (Medical Device MNC / Office Hours / 2 years contract)
Job_Descriptions: Who We Are BD is a leading global medical technology company that creates medical technology, devices and laboratory equipment for a variety of needs across the healthcare sector. At BD, we are looking for candidates who possess passion, innovative solutions and a commitment to our one mission of improving access to groundbreaking medical and biotechnology services for people near and far, delivering state-of-the-art technology and cutting-edge research in the battle to fight and cure infectious diseases. With a global reach that extends across 50 countries worldwide, our network of professionals collaborates on effective measures to deliver enhanced patient quality such as lower health care delivery costs, improved health care and safety, and expanded health care for all. Join our company and see how you can become a part of one global mission to make a difference in human health. Purpose: The QA Technical Specialist reports to the Quality Engineer – Laboratory. This role is responsible and accountable for product, raw materials testing and release, labels/packaging materials inspection and release and/or equipment calibration/Preventive Maintenance. You will perform inspection of: (1) purchased materials/labels and printed labels from suppliers, (2) manufactured semi-finished products and finished products and, (3) manage equipment calibration/preventive maintenances through the Blue Mountain Regulatory Asset Management Database (BMRAM)/SAP. You must ensure that the methods of inspection adhere to processes and procedures, and materials/products meet acceptance criteria defined in material specifications/engineering drawings. This is a 2 years contract. Renewal or conversion to permanent role is possible, subjective to individual performance, business needs and headcount availability. Job Responsibilities: Test and release purchased materials for meeting the acceptance criteria by thorough examination using the material/ label/ packaging materials specifications and approved test methods and procedures. Test and release semi-finished products and finished product according to approved test methods and procedures. Releases material / label / packaging Materials product if all test data shows it to be suitable for using. If the material / label / product is to be rejected, initiates appropriate action through managerial channels. Review of Batch History Records for verification and accountability of the lot and release if found acceptable. If any discrepancy is noted initiates appropriate action through managerial channels. Assist in testing and data reporting of any stability and expiration date validation studies. For any out of tolerances/ failure found during incoming, inporcess, outgoing or stability/ validation studies inspection; generates Quality Nonconforming (QM) in SAP Database and/ or Out of Specification Investigation (OOS), where applicable and communicates issues to responsible Quality Engineer(s). Clearly and accurately records the result of inspection on appropriate inspection forms or electronically in SAP Database. Performs test of DI water system in accordance to written procedures and notifies Manufacturing Facilitator and Quality Engineer - Laboratory if any deviation. Monitors and updates calibration and maintenance schedules in BM RAM/ SAP. Supports Quality Engineer - Laboratory for timely completion of calibration and maintenance monthly. Sends equipment to an accredited laboratory for external calibration and defective measuring equipment to a repairing vendor for servicing. Performs internal calibration/ PM of measuring equipment in accordance to established calibration/PM procedures. Ensures that only calibrated equipment/ tool is used for inspection per standard operating procedure and handles tools appropriately to prevent damage. Works in a team environment, supports engineering, reporting dimensional, statistical, capability measurement system data, data collection, etc. Support the monitoring of adequate label / literature laboratory supplies inventory. Maintain and monitor the retention samples inventory, storage conditions and the expiration date and coordinate the discard of expired samples. Participates and contributes to continuous improvement activities. Keeps abreast of the basic requirements for compliance in own area of work and complies with those requirements, brings regulatory compliance questions/ issues to the attention of management. Our Requirements: Nitec/Higher Nitec/Diploma in any Engineering field, Chemistry, Biological Sciences (Microbiology). At least 1-2 years of working experience in an industrial laboratory or QA environment. (such as general laboratory experience, Calibration and Preventive Maintenances program or Non-conforming handling in medical devices, pharmaceutical or life science industry.) Added advantage with knowledge and experience in SAP, Microsoft Excel and/or Word. Good communication skill to convey clearly to immediate supervisor, if any deviation were to be found during the testing. Culture and Benefits Here at BD, we embrace a growth mindset, building capabilities for the future and helping you become the best version of yourself. We offer our employees a clear direction and career pathway for development. We pride ourselves on our transparent and rigorous talent processes that are inclusive, deeply embedded in trust, aligned with our culture, and enable us to achieve strategic imperatives of the organization. Our leaders are committed, engaged and accountable to making talent our top priority. How To Apply Submit your application by clicking on the “apply” button at the top of the page. Primary Work Location SGP Tuas - Tuas Plant

Job_Title: Associate Specialist, Emerging Talent Rotation Program (ETR)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Emerging Talent Rotation Program Our Company is an innovative, global healthcare leader committed to improving health and well-being in 140 countries around the world. Our product categories include heart and respiratory health, diabetes, infectious diseases, oncology and women's health. We continue to focus our research on conditions that affect millions of people around the world - diseases like Alzheimer's, Diabetes and Cancer - while further expanding our strengths in areas such as vaccines and biologics.  We aspire to be the best healthcare company in the world and provide innovative solutions for tomorrow. We are seeking talented individual, who possesses both leadership potential, as well as critical IT capabilities, to join our Emerging Talent Rotation (ETR) Program; a two-year program during which, candidates can rotate and experience three diverse areas (eight months in each area), within the Singapore IT Hub. This program offers candidate a path of differentiated exposure and investment, in order to develop their technical, business, and leadership capabilities so that they know our Company’s business, understand IT processes and will engage meaningfully to help positively affect the company economics and impact the value realization of IT and business solutions. Successful candidate will be partnered with a buddy, a coach and an executive mentor who will be able to help with acculturation at our Company and career planning. Primary activities/responsibilities Rotations are assigned based on the individual’s development interest, discussions with their mentor, and alignment with business needs Areas of IT Expertise Data Science Enterprise Platforms Commercial Capabilities Infrastructure, Client Computing and Network Services Manufacturing Division Application Management Services Operations Management Strategy Execution / Project Management Office (PMO) Research & Development Patient Engagement Human Health Division Cybersecurity & Risk Management Software Engineering & Design Thinking Education Minimum Requirement: Recent Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree or equivalent Degree preferably in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Computer Science (or similar) Required Experience and Skills: Passion for technology and healthcare Superior communication and interpersonal skills Team-oriented self-starter Demonstrated leadership abilities Effectively work under pressure Eye for creativity Curious to learn Spirit of innovation Independent, reliable and committed Who we are … We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world. What we look for … In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth . INVENT. IMPACT. INSPIRE. We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. Job_Title: Manufacturing Engineer (Medical Device MNC / Office Hours)
Job_Descriptions: Who We Are BD is a leading global medical technology company that creates medical technology, devices and laboratory equipment for a variety of needs across the healthcare sector. At BD, we are looking for candidates who possess passion, innovative solutions and a commitment to our one mission of improving access to groundbreaking medical and biotechnology services for people near and far, delivering state-of-the-art technology and cutting-edge research in the battle to fight and cure infectious diseases. With a global reach that extends across 50 countries worldwide, our network of professionals collaborates on effective measures to deliver enhanced patient quality such as lower health care delivery costs, improved health care and safety, and expanded health care for all. Purpose: As a Manufacturing Engineer, you will assist your Manager and Senior Engineer to lead and supervise a team of 1 Senior Technical Specialist, 5 Technical Specialist and over 100 Production Technician in meeting customer expectation such as quality, cost and deliver. You are involved in projects to develop and implement manufacturing processes and engineering activities to support new product development and existing product enhancement. Job Description Internship Opportunities in Biomedical Research At our Company, we are committed to be the premier, research-intensive biopharmaceutical company and are dedicated to providing leading innovations and solutions for today and the future. Our mission is to discover, develop and provide medicines and vaccines that save and improve lives around the world. We strive to transform breakthrough science into novel therapeutics and vaccines and our scientific curiosity drives us to invent solutions to some of the world's most challenging diseases. Many begin in the our Research Laboratories, where we push the boundaries of science with the hope and expectation that the medicines and vaccines we invent will lead to better health for society for generations to come. In Singapore, our Translational Medicine Research Centre is located within the Biopolis, the heart of Singapore’s biomedical research community. Here, we are focused on identifying and validating new drug targets, exploring innovative therapeutic modalities and leveraging clinical studies and patient–derived material to understand biomarkers of disease or therapeutic response to increase our understanding of human biology and to drive a therapeutic pipeline to address unmet medical needs. Our state-of-the-art laboratory supports discovery biology and translational medicine and is an integral part of our Company's world-class network for drug and vaccine discovery. As an intern within our research laboratories, you will gain the opportunity to work with talented and dedicated scientists, learn from leading industry experts, gain exposure and professional experience working for a research-driven enterprise; and use your passion, creativity, knowledge and collaboration skills to find solutions to challenging problems in your day-to-day work. Position Title: Research Intern, Cancer Biology (Quantitative Biosciences) Job Purpose: The Research Intern will work closely with an assigned scientific supervisor on a lab-based biomedical research project in the area of target validation, immuno-oncology or cancer biology. Project title: Optimization of intracellular mRNA delivery Chemically modified messenger RNA (mRNA) are a highly promising therapeutic modality to treat various diseases. Recent advances in mRNA technology accompanied with the successes of the mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccines from Moderna and Pfizer-BioNtech have generated momentum to this field. However, delivery to the specific target site and off-target toxicities remain to be addressed with mRNA therapeutics. pH and redox-responsive coacervating peptides were recently developed to efficiently deliver various cargo including proteins, peptides and mRNA into the cell. In this project, the intern will characterize coacervates to deliver mRNA and perform comparisons with other in vitro delivery vehicles (Lipid nanoparticles (LNP), transfection reagents) in terms of mRNA expression and vehicle-induced toxicity in cell lines of interest. With respect to toxicity, this could be probed further by looking at innate immune activation which has been reported to be triggered by some LNPs. It would also be worthwhile to explore their mechanism of entry into cells, which is currently hypothesized to be endocytosis-independent, so this could be compared to cargo delivered via dfTAT which triggers leakage of endosomes. In addition, there could be the opportunity to test and evaluate other coacervating peptide analogs, with the goal of identifying an appropriate coacervate vehicle to deliver mRNA in vivo. Learning Outcome to be gained by the intern Key learnings for student: mRNA therapeutics, Molecular biology and signaling pathways, Cell culture and mRNA transfection, Cellular assays e.g. viability/toxicity assays, imaging techniques, western blotting, Data analysis and presentation Qualification: Enrollment in an Undergraduate or Master’s program leading to a Diploma/Degree in a Biomedical Sciences, Biological Sciences or Life Sciences-related discipline. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world. What we look for … In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. SGInternship2022 We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. regional activities for the TA and brands Provide support to the AP Medical TA team to deliver the AP MAF Strategy and Plan: Work with the Medical Directors/Advisors and Medical Education Specialists to gather input for the AP Medical Affairs Plan(s) for designated product(s) Approve the AP Medical Affairs Plan for allocated product(s) Work with the TA teams in AP to proactively identify and duplication of clinical, advocacy and access programmes across countries, and facilitate co-ordination between AP Medical Affairs, CDT, Strategic Marketing, Health Economics and the individual countries in AP A member of the GMAT: To represent the unified AP voice for the TA To shape AP MAF Strategy for the TA To ensure timely and reliable input from AP into the Compound Development Team (CDT), including input into phase II/III study designs, and country and site selection for the respective TA To ensure input into the Global Clinical Program with the aim to have representation from appropriate AP countries To provide input on breakthrough research in line with the unmet medical/social needs in AP region Accountable for line management of AP Directors / Medical Advisors, and dotted line for Medical Education Specialists and Coordinators Allocation of responsibilities for product ownership and other activities Clear articulation of goals and objective setting Performance management and performance evaluation Additional coaching and feedback for direct reports as required Development plans and requisite training A core member of the AP Medical Affairs Leadership Team strategy, to specific protocols, and to services ensuring high-quality patient care Product Safety and Regulatory Requirements As per the J&J guidance and SOPs: Ensure that medical Directors/Advisors manage product-related medical safety issues and provide input to AP Pharmacovigilance & Medical Compliance, Janssen AP Medical Affairs and Global Safety Management Teams (SMTs) Work with Regulatory Affairs & Product Issue Management Team to coordinate and manage product-related issues and support major quality incidents / recalls throughout Janssen AP Escalate issues and enquiries to VP MAF AP Region as appropriate Ensure adequate clinical input is provided to Company Core Data Sheet and Patient Information by the MAF Director / Advisor update process and where appropriate ensure development and approval of clinical overviews Study Planning and Execution Drive data gap analysis, data generation and data dissemination plans Ensure that all AP MAF protocols (Regional AP and single country) are in alignment with, and support, the medical strategy for the TA For regional studies, ensure there is a  Study Responsible Physician (SRP), and oversee the SRP and ensure they follow AP Medical Affairs Study Planning and Execution SOPs Provide Medical Directors/Advisors and local TA teams with scientific support regarding clinical study design, statistical analysis plans, CSRs, publications, etc. Actively participate as a core member of the AP Protocol Review Committee Publications and communications Develop the AP MAF publication and communication strategy and plans for the TA (as part of the MAF Strategy and Plan for allocated product(s), in alignment with the Global publication strategy) Medical Education Approve Regional AP Medical Education activities as part of the MAF plans for the products in the TA Drive the medical education strategy and content in support of the TA Other Activities as Required Provide input to AP business development initiatives for allocated product(s) when requested Partner with the late lifecycle management group to provide proactive medical input for lifecycle extension opportunities as appropriate ACCOUNTABILITIES: The Network Tools and Services Engineer will operate, support automation, and maintain the DDI (DNS, DHCP and IPAM), and NTP systems across the enterprise. In addition to managing the system, the engineer will be responsible for managing address allocations and their integrity. The role is primarily focused on the proper design and implementation of the enterprise DDI framework. As a key member of the Network Tools Engineering team, this individual will be responsible for delivering high-level and low-level designs for DDI and Time Services technologies. Will contribute to and adhere to the J&J design standards within this space, while closely working and collaborating with cross-functional peers. Will be expected to drive engineering solutions, support project delivery, and act as a subject matter expert within network tools and the DDI area. Key Responsibilities & Professional Competencies: Ensure the DDI Infoblox platforms and services are managed and maintained Develop automation and support embedded API calls for external system integration to Infoblox Develop scripts and automation to support IPAM as a service, and to maintain system Report on availability, response times of DNS and API, data integrity, and capacity of the Infoblox Deliver high-level and low-level design of DDI, and Time Services Drive delivery of DDI solutions, including project and implementation support Provide DDI consulting services to peer Engineering, Operations, and other teams Provide Level 3 / Level 4 escalation support for Network Operations Proactively work with internal partners to determine growth requirements and ensure proper capacity is needed to meet demand Provide governance support for product life cycle management which will include technology refresh and ensuring adherence to standards for products in the portfolio. Assists in planning regional budget and identifying critical budget needs for the region. Assist in the development of consistent design, deployment, maintenance, and decommissioning of Networking Tools and Services across J&J Global Network Services Provide engineering support related to issues, and/or addition of new features and functionalities on existing networking tools Assist in the research and evaluation of new tools and services to ensure the organization is using the best technologies to meet GNS and business strategic goals. Provide strong technical expertise and guidance on the networking tools to support defining roadmap and strategies; including maturation of existing technologies, new tools and services development, and integrations. Provide technical knowledge transfer sessions with peer organizations and suppliers regarding changes in procedures, processes, documentation, and frameworks. Establish and maintain regular communications with peers, architects, engineering, deployment as well as operations teams, suppliers, and vendors regarding requisite network infrastructure changes, improvement opportunities, and support. Consult with peer organizations and management on standard methodologies for the process and procedures to deploy & support Network Tools at scale. Consistently drive a mindset for network automation, network program-ability, and repeatable/reusable processes. Qualifications Required Skills: In-depth experience of DNS, DHCP, IPAM, DNSSEC, BIND, and Time Services (GPS, NTP, PTP). High degree of experience in the day-to-day configuration and Sr. level troubleshooting of these services. Experience in installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Infoblox suite of products in a large distributed environment Integration of DNS and DHCP in Active Directory environment, and Cloud Providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). Creating & modifying DNS zone files manually (forward and reverse zones) DNS Anycast Experience in change and incident management. 4+ years of deep technical experience working on DDI environments 6+ years of Enterprise Network experience with a highly available global network infrastructure BS or BA in computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience of DDI in a large enterprise. Advanced Linux and/or UNIX skills Experience with Rest API, Scripting, Programming languages - JSON, Python, Bash, Ansible, Powershell Strong written and verbal communication skills Excellent organizational and time management skills Analytical, data-driven problem solver Preferred Skills, Experience, and Education: Cloud Service Providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), certification is a plus Experience implementing and maintaining Network Management, Performance and Monitoring tools like Cisco Prime, Cisco DNA-C, Cisco ISE, ThousandEyes, LogicMonitor, Netscout. In-depth knowledge and experience with TCP/IP, network management protocols and features, i.e SNMP, Netlfow, sFlow, cFlowd, Packet Analysis. Knowledge of F5 LTM and GTM, BIG-IQ is a plus Routing protocols like BGP, EIGRP, L2/L3 LAN, WLAN, Campus networks, Firewalls, and Load-balancers experience Solid understanding of Software-Defined Data Centers and Cloud Networking Knowledge of DevOps Fundamentals, and Automation Tooling, Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) Knowledge of Git-based Version Control Systems (GitLab, GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.), JIRA. Good understanding of Containers/Microservices Primary Location Singapore-Singapore-Singapore- Organization Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435) Job Function Info Technology Requisition ID 2206003503W

About Appen Appen collects and labels images, text, speech, audio, video, and other data used to build and continuously improve the world’s most innovative artificial intelligence systems. Our expertise includes having a global crowd of over 1 million skilled contractors who speak over 235 languages, in over 70,000 locations and 170 countries, and the industry’s most advanced AI-assisted data annotation platform. Our reliable training data gives leaders in technology, automotive, financial services, retail, healthcare, and governments the confidence to deploy world-class AI products. Founded in 1996, Appen has customers and offices globally. Why Appen? You enjoy competitive pay and benefit from having no set work hours or schedules. You will have the flexibility to schedule your hours to fit your lifestyle and to work around your career and family demands. You have the freedom to choose when and how much you would like to work. Task Description We are looking for people from all over the world to participate in some of our many exciting work-from-home opportunities. These opportunities range from simple surveys that can be completed in less than one hour to ongoing projects that last for months or longer. Leverage your social media interest, mobile device savviness, your college degree in linguistics, online research skills, or passion for images, video, or audio. With so many diverse projects, chances are we’ve got something for you. Appen contributors conduct in-depth internet-based research and provide information evaluation for leading companies from around the globe. Ideal candidates are self-reliant, self-motivated, are very internet savvy, have a broad range of interests, and enjoy online research and evaluation. Here are examples of some of the opportunities that may be available: Search Media Evaluation Social Media Evaluation Translation Services Transcription Services Survey and Data Collection (Short projects that last from 15 minutes to three hours) Linguistic Specialties (Text to Speech, Computational, Phonetics, Pronunciation, Annotation, etc.) Lexicon Annotation Speech Evaluation Image Annotation and/or Transcription Video Annotation Sensor Data Annotation i.e., LiDAR, Radar, etc. General Requirements Excellent web research skills and analytical abilities Excellent comprehension and written communication skills High-speed internet access (Cable Modem, DSL, etc.) A personal computer running Google's free Chrome web browser, version 45 or newer, or, for some assignments, specific mobile devices – i.e., smartphones, tablets, etc. Up to date anti-virus and anti-spyware software What You Need To Be Successful You must be smart, curious, and enjoy online research. You must pass a qualification exam on many projects to make sure you understand the requirements. You must be a motivated, self-driven, organized individual, and you should do well. Interested? Please click the link to apply http://https://connect.appen.com/qrp/public/home?sref=427ed2b7c8fe4516a5ee(phone number)e7 Once you complete the registration process, you will be able to receive feedback via email or direct through the Appen Connect platform. If you are interested in also applying for other projects, make sure that you complete your profile so you can unlock more projects for your account! “A diverse, inclusive culture is vital to our mission of helping build better AI. We offer opportunities for individuals of all abilities and backgrounds.”

We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022

About the Role As our Data Analyst for the Commerce Enablement team, you’ll collaborate with other cross-functional teams (Product Managers, Business Strategists, Marketing, Research, and Data Science) to find useful business insights within a large amount of data. You’ll assist these teams in setting up success metrics for particular products/features, optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability. You’ll process data streams to produce data foundation, analytical dashboards, and product/feature trackers on a daily basis. Here, you'll get a front-row seat in understanding how one of the largest Asian SuperApps makes use of its data. Your efforts will help remove highly complex analytical blockers presented to the team and contribute to the overall expansion and efficiency of Gojek's Merchant platform. What You Will Do Consult and partner with business and technology stakeholders to understand their problems and develop and implement high impact, data driven solutions Utilize various sources of data to support analytical projects, conduct deep-dive analysis, and create new products Proactive in developing tools/analysis, and improving business metrics to keep them relevant to the company’s growth Work closely with Product Managers and Business teams to help them create data-driven decisions What You Will Need At least 1 year of experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or other related roles that require strong analytical skills, problem-solving, and business acumen (preferably from the payment/ fintech industry) Experience in SQL and data visualization (e.g. Tableau and Metabase) Strong statistical knowledge and able to independently select and implement the correct statistical test to answer the business question Good R/Python skills to perform advanced analysis (hypothesis testing, predictive model, clustering, etc) Solid understanding of machine learning modeling A self-driven attitude with a strong sense of ownership; ability to work independently to solve problems and develop solutions Ability to use critical thinking to manage daily tasks while being goal-oriented Ability to transform an ambiguous business or product problem into a well-scoped and impactful analysis About the Team The Commerce Enablement team is a family of 120+ engineers based in Jakarta, Singapore, and India. We consistently strive to implement solutions that allow our merchant partners in Indonesia (and the greater Southeast Asian region) to sell their products both online and offline. We also work to improve the merchant-partner experience through product innovation and integration with the rest of the Gojek ecosystem. Internally, we promote a culture of engineering excellence, learning, and guided career growth. We advocate sustainable engineering practices, innovation, and working smart more so than working hard. We aim to be a world-class organization, implementing world-class solutions, with world-class engineers leading the way. Our portfolio of products includes merchant-facing solutions that enable our subscribed merchant-partners to sell their goods and services both online and offline. Southeast Asia is a highly dynamic market, where products have to react promptly to market trends and shifts, and where product managers and business leads need the flexibility to experiment and iterate fast. With that in mind, from an engineering perspective, our challenges are to evolve a general platform for e-commerce that is sufficiently versatile to support rapid product iterations across multiple products, as well as scaling up to an ever-growing user base. To tackle these challenges, we have adopted event-driven architectural patterns in our engineering designs, as well as agile practices across all our day-to-day processes. This COVID era has been hard on all of us. Off-hours, we are doing our best to stay in touch and continue to bond through fun, playful online activities. Once COVID is over, we are looking forward to resuming our regular team-wide social activities such as dinner-and-drinks evenings and team off-sites.

Minimum qualifications: Experience in recruiting, staffing operations, HR, or related area. Ability to speak and write in English fluently in order to communicate with representatives from external stakeholders in-market, who may be from English-speaking countries. Preferred qualifications: Experience in APAC sourcing and recruitment. Experience with solving complex problems and delivering significant impact as an individual contributor. Experience with sustained performance, accountability, strong work ethic, and integrity. Ability to solve complex problems and deliver significant impact as business partner. Ability to manage customer relationship management and provide customer consultative skills. Data-driven and highly analytical with the ability to translate data and trends into powerful hiring strategies. About the job Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, which allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient. In this role, you will help leaders across APAC focus on products that make Google magical everyday. You will be responsible for full life-cycle recruiting, sourcing, evaluating, and hiring candidates. You will use your communication skills to tell meaningful stories using data and to influence decisions. As a Global Business Organizations Recruiter, you'll balance creativity, drive, and savvy. In the process of execution, you will build advisory partnerships with business leaders and relationships with candidates. You'll own hiring strategy, sourcing, and maintain client relationships. By leveraging your knowledge of our clients' hiring needs, candidate market supply and diversity expectations, you’ll effectively match candidates with the roles in which they will be most successful. Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices. Resposibilities Implement staffing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) strategy to achieve an annual hiring plan that emphasizes quality and diversity of hires. Demonstrate positive influence on agreed Singapore site-wide or pan-APAC strategy and advocate Google’s diversity initiatives. Identify synergies and opportunities to streamline hiring efficiency across multiple functions. Recruit talent and achieve quarterly hiring goals. Provide a high-quality experience for every candidate from application stage to offer. Set and deliver clear milestones and effectively engage leadership.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in technical customer support, IT operations, or systems administration. Experience in working with operating systems/networks. Preferred qualifications: Experience in supporting Chrome OS, Windows, Mac OS, Unix, Networking; scripting and automation; application troubleshooting. Experience with creating or optimizing deployment and/or support processes for desktops, laptops, video conferencing, wireless devices, software, and patches. Strong understanding of complex IT infrastructure and ability to troubleshoot issues. Understanding of local and wide area network (LAN/WAN) and mobile computing environments. Excellent customer service, organizational, prioritization, multitasking, communication, and leadership skills. About the job Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As a Corporate Operations Engineer you are the go-to person for Googlers' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Google's internal tools and technologies. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Beyond the day-to-day, you improve the Googler user experience by contributing to longer term projects and documentation efforts. You are highly technical and are comfortable problem solving with multiple operating systems (like OS X, Linux, Windows) and a range of devices (including desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices). You occasionally partner with various teams including security, networking and infrastructure. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the IT needs of global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds. You improve the front-line user experience by providing on-demand user support for Google's corporate users, resources, tools and applications while also contributing to longer-term projects. At Corp Eng, we build world-leading business solutions that scale a more helpful Google for everyone. As Google’s IT organization, we provide end-to-end solutions for organizations across Google. With an inclusive mindset, we deliver the right tools, platforms, and experiences for all Googlers as they create more helpful products and services for everyone. In the simplest terms, we are Google for Googlers. Resposibilities Partner with and lead peers, vendors and other technical support teams (to coordinate troubleshooting, process and resolution for incidents and problems in a timely manner). Use insights gained through direct support to advocate for users, working with partner teams to identify problematic user journeys and prioritize solutions. Provide direct and remote root cause analysis of IT issues on multiple technologies and platforms, including hardware, software, tools, services, networks, integrated video and audio conferencing equipment at Google scale. Develop scripts, tools, processes or solutions to prevent problems, improve user productivity and automate recurring tasks as part of longer term and global service improvements. Participate in or lead IT projects, ensuring they are designed and planned well, delivering a solution or technical improvement. Analyze all relevant data to show the business impact of projects.

Minimum qualifications: 6 years of experience in the digital advertising sector, with an Ad Tech company or leading Ad Platform. Experience in leading operational initiatives. Preferred qualifications: Understanding of product development and activation processes in an internet, software, or other technology setting. Ability to lead simultaneous projects in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. Ability to translate data and trends into strategies and compelling messaging, and build decision-making frameworks for the team and leadership. Effective networking and influencing skills, with the ability to work across various functions. Excellent people leadership and cross-functional collaboration skills, and data-driven and highly analytical. Entrepreneurial spirit to seek out customer insights, build momentum with cross-functional team around trends, and investments needed for a two to three year horizon. About the job Our team’s primary focus is to grow the business and drive ecosystem initiatives that support the Video and Display publisher business. As the Platforms Lead, you will be the primary link between the Online Partnerships Group teams and global product teams. You will play an essential role in translating global product strategy into tactical product initiatives tailored to the needs of our region and to our partners and drive cross-functional collaboration across multiple teams. In this role, you will lead multiple concurrent projects, work with tight deadlines, execute across short- and long-term horizons, collaborate effectively across all levels of our organization, and present to internal and external audiences. The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. About Us Far East Organization’s Sales and Leasing Group manages a large and diverse portfolio of quality real estate for sale and lease to suit different business and individual needs. The group’s portfolio comprises residential, office, industrial and medical units across the island with over 1,000 units for sale and 6.5 million square feet of lettable space. As Singapore’s largest private property developer and residential landlord, the group’s wide array of housing options seek to serve the extensive needs of buyers and investors as well as the expatriate and local communities looking for long-term stays. The Sales Consultant is responsible for the sales and marketing of Far East properties, contributing to the individual, department, and organization sales targets. Job_Descriptions: Location: Singapore Singapore Job ID: 743999804523500HS Date Posted: Feb 9, 2022 Segment: IT Business Unit: Hitachi Solutions Company Name: Hitachi Solutions Ltd Job Schedule: Full-time Company Description Hitachi Solutions is a core IT Company of the Hitachi Group, which employs over 330,000 people worldwide. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, Hitachi Solutions' reach extends to group companies in Japan and abroad, working with a worldwide network of alliance partners. We strive to provide ideal solutions and products to customers in a diverse set of countries and regions including Asia, North America, and Europe. Using a portfolio of management consulting, implementation, and support services, we help our clients compete with the largest global enterprises leveraging powerful, affordable, and easy to use industry solutions built on Microsoft technologies. Our vision is to help our customers achieve their vision through superior products, prices, and people. Hitachi solutions has been recognized as the winner for the 2021 Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service Partner of the Year Award and also named a finalist for the Dynamics 365 Customer Service Partner of the Year, Dynamics 365 Marketing Partner of the Year, Dynamics 365 Sales Partner of the Year, and Government Partner of the Year. Job Description JOB OBJECTIVE To be able to provide full cycle implementation, consulting, configuration, training, installation and support for clients using Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations/ Microsoft Dynamics AX. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Work as Business Analyst on the assigned engagement. Present Conference Room Pilot showing Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations / Dynamics AX solution fit to the customer's needs Advise customer organization on solution usage and help minimize gaps between standard product customer's business processes with creative configuration. Prepare Business Process Discovery Documents. Configure Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations/ Dynamics AX Trade and Logistics, Inventory, Supply Chain modules Prepare functional specification for customizations required. Job_Title: 2022 H2 Internship (Jul - Dec): Product-Led Growth Intern
Job_Descriptions: About Workato Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it’s built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful. Simultaneously, it’s a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases. We’re proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning. Why join us? Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles . We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company. But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care . That’s why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives. If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you! Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike. Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We’ve been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We’re proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator. **Xendit will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Xendit’s sponsorship of a visa.** Mission Our Experiments team builds growth engines for Xendit through experimental products. We do this by pushing the frontiers of what is possible in the industry and creating modern solutions to old problems. We're looking for an experienced software engineer to innovate and iterate our way to a great solution. It will help if you have a strong interest in growth (personally and professionally) and, therefore, a continuous improvement mindset. We also highly regard someone that is unyielding in reliable, scalable, and readable code. You will join a small technical team and make technical decisions that will drive growth for our company. To solve for customers, you will also work closely with our business teams and work directly with our CEO. Responsibilities Build entire business tech solutions as experiments with best practice and scalability in mind Build tooling to help us do that easier Help guide business requirements with technical feasibility and constraints Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed You may be a good fit if 2+ years of a successful track record of developing quality software products and shipping production-ready software Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferably in Computer Science, or equivalent experience Experience in any of the following: Node.js - TypeScript, Golang Experience with relational and NoSQL database schema design and query optimization Strong knowledge of REST and pub/sub design patterns Experience with unit, integration, and E2E test frameworks Experience with Agile development Ability to break down complex business requirements into technical requirements Ability to architect distributed systems on cloud computing platforms Thrive on being independent and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourself Communicate well You may have an advantage if Familiar with Domain-Driven Design Comfortable with modern DevOps: k8s, terraform What we care about Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines You’re like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don’t take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule. You’re remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can’t find someone who raves about you then it’s unlikely we will too.

Job Description We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager, ASEAN, to help shape Procore’s go-to-market message in the ASEAN region from the ground up. In this first-of-its-kind role, you’ll join our growing APAC Marketing team, focusing on audience and solutions marketing. As a Product Marketing Manager, ASEAN, you’ll become an expert in the construction industry by diving deep into our buyer segments, connecting with customers and prospects, and digesting market intelligence and research. This is a tremendous opportunity to leverage your attention to detail and eye for quality to transform customer challenges into value propositions. If you’re up for the challenge—we’d love to hear from you! This position will report to our APAC Product Marketing Lead and will be based in our Singapore office. International travel may be required, specifically in the ASEAN territories, when borders reopen and travel safety improves. We’re looking for someone to join our team immediately. What you’ll do: Be the voice of Procore’s customers in ASEAN and the regional audience expert for construction/construction tech to the rest of the Procore business Develop an expert understanding of Procore’s current and future buyers, their pains, and how our solutions can help Work closely with the ASEAN Campaign team to develop effective campaigns by providing clear audience segmentation, targeting, positioning, and messaging Provide the ASEAN Sales team with talk tracks, pitch decks, content, and assets they need to convert prospects into customers Enable internal and external stakeholders, such as PR agencies, content creators, and creative agencies, with messaging guidance Partner with your colleagues in the Global Product and Solutions Marketing team to identify product/solution requirements for the ASEAN region, localise product content, and own the local product release roadmap regarding prioritisation and messaging Be prepared to write, shape, or lead content production, including battle cards, persona cards, case studies, email templates, blogs, articles, websites, and other supporting documentation Continuously monitor revenue funnel metrics to identify where and why Procore is winning and losing and how to improve conversion rates What we’re looking for: Bachelor’s degree is preferred or equivalent work experience 7+ years of solid B2B product marketing experience, SaaS domain expertise is a plus Enviable track record of successfully leading go-to-market programmes in a fast-paced, high growth environment High attention to detail with excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and another Asian language is highly desirable (Mandarin/Bahasa/Malay) Highly analytical with the ability to leverage data to understand key customer problems and translate insights into targeted marketing plans Customer-centric strategic mindset with a can-do attitude and hands-on approach Ability to motivate stakeholders and sell ideas through creative and innovative presentations to obtain buy-in Self-driven with exceptional project management skills with internal and external stakeholders Quick learner with an eagerness to gain a rapid understanding of the construction software industry Adaptable and able to react quickly to constantly changing market dynamics Ability to work in Singapore Additional Information If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community . About Us Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. Job_Descriptions: Job Description Recruiting delivery drivers Join our crew of drivers , delivering Singpost Parcels. Have your own vehicle Car or SUV or Van Job Scope: 0815 am report to warehouse in greenwich, supervisor assign the area of your day, scan in parcels, load , deliver. Finish delivery go home. Week 2 , increase again as per your progress and experience and greenlight from supervisor. Over the weeks and months, keep gaining experience till you can handle 150 parcels a day ( 150*$2=$300) Payment: Job done on 1 feb to 15 feb = Payment on 2 March Job done on 16 feb to 28 feb = Payment on 17 March Every 2nd of the month and 17th of the month is payday Work Days: Minimum commitment = 3 days a week. Either work 3 days a week minimum , or work more than 3 days a week up to you. Delivery Area: One day one area. Example day 1, supervisor assign you to chua chu kang day 2 assign to bukit panjang day 3 assign to serangoon. Not suitable for drivers who want fixed area. Great that you're thinking about a career with BSI! Job Purpose : The Regional Business Manager (RBM) is responsible for developing BSI Standards’ sales in a defined territory by winning new business and maintaining existing accounts against set targets. The RBM will bring strong business development and management skills to sell across the BSI Standards’ digital portfolio and potentially any other relevant BSI services. Selling directly to the customer and indirectly through BSI country offices in ASEAN, the RBM will bring experience of working in more than one market in the region. The RBM is responsible to manage the direct sales cycle, from lead generation to closed sale. Based in Singapore or Malaysia is ideal, other regions across APAC will be considered upon application. Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities : Territory Development Create and develop plans which will develop each country/sector and sales channel Develop internal and external BSI network with colleagues within standards market development teams, customer services, subscription support, marketing and Group wide business streams with key goals for short, medium and long term business expansion Maintain and update territory/sector/competitor intelligence through various sources Direct Sales Development Analyse existing business in ASEAN Region to formulate regional strategy and operational plans to maximise sales revenue To develop, maximise and manage the sales of BSI’s online subscription products to customers in ASEAN Region Identify and qualify potential country/sector business developments opportunities and work closely with the marketing team to create, monitor and evaluate campaigns and collateral To have a prospect list and to make full use of internal and external data to profile potential subscription customers To drive marketing campaigns aimed at identified sectors to ensure the proposition is correct and the campaign is executed and measured in the most effective way Account Management and Renewals Manage to retain all existing subscription accounts in territory Have full understanding of all accounts and develop renewal strategy Direct and support local country sales teams with a view to increase revenue through upselling Local Country Sales Team Management Help set and deliver targets and key goals across all BSI country offices in the region Provide training, support and motivation where required Work with the Head of International Sales to make tactical decisions regarding channels to ensure that the customers’ requirements and expectations are met and exceeded and that revenue for BSI is maximised and not merely switched between channels Ensure BSI KS receives pipeline information for prospects from all countries in the region Drive, help and deliver a clear, cohesive and structured sales strategy and plan for each key sector/country in ASEAN Region Sales Process Ensure Salesforce records are accurate and up to date to aid sales reporting and pipeline management, including maintaining the monthly opportunity wave to ensure efficient application of time and efforts Using metrics from Salesforce data manage develop and improve the sales pipeline for new and renewal business. Use data to improve working methods, strategic plans and behaviours to reduce response time and improve conversion ratios, average sale values and customer on boarding Using lead and activity data from Salesforce, revise and improve sales and marketing plans and behaviours to target sectors/countries more efficiently and increase the quantity and quality of leads generated to ensure the sales funnel is well fed General To help train new starters from local countries - on products, sales techniques, internal processes, existing customer base, sectors and explain territory business strategy clearly To attend management/team meetings as required To contribute to improvements in current sales processes Liaise with internal teams on new and key renewal customer expectations and resolution of queries/requests to facilitate new acquisitions Liaise with other departments and areas of the BSI Standards’ such as online support, marketing, customer services, membership and finance to share and increase knowledge and skills and to develop further opportunities and relationships across the business and with customers and partners Key Outputs/Success Factors : To meet and exceed the annual quarterly new sales target in the region To meet and exceed the annual renewal target in the region To report to Head of International Sales with accurate and detailed sales figures To use SFDC to accurately forecast sales in any given month and quarter To manage SFDC correctly To ensure that lead and opportunity generation and conversion targets are met and exceeded To develop and communicate country and sector plans for both New and Renewal accounts Knowledge/Skills/Abilities : Speak, Read and Write one or more local language at professional level is essential Proven experience and track record of delivering and exceeding annual sales targets for new business and existing accounts management Must have demonstrable sales and business development experience within a business environment Must have demonstrable relationship building skills both internally and externally Experienced in consultative sales approach with a focus on understanding explicit client needs and responding with compelling proposals for customised solutions Strong objection handling and negotiation skills Experienced in engaging with customers at a senior management level Experienced in developing sector/country development plans The ability to manage and drive relationships within BSI local sales and marketing staff Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. These three behaviours represent how we do things at BSI. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business. BSI is conducting face-to-face interviews where appropriate and possible. If you are invited to a face-to-face interview but feel more comfortable with conducting the interview virtually, please speak to a member of our recruitment team.

Job_Title: Group Design Leader - Culinary & Snacks ASEAN
Job_Descriptions: Are you inspired to contribute your expertise to a global leading Ingredients organization? We are a global leader in taste, scent and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of solutions for the food & beverage industry. We are looking for a dedicated and passionate individual to join Nourish team as Group Design Leader, Culinary and Snacks - ASEAN . Come join the global Ingredients leader where science and creativity meet to create essential solutions for a better world! Your Focus As Group Design Leader, Culinary and Snacks - ASEAN, you will lead our Culinary Application and Snack Creation teams driving Innovations thus providing optimal Technical support enabling the successful execution of the ASEAN business growth plans. Interact effectively at multiple levels of the organization and geography to identify and communicate current and future innovation, product, resource and expertise needs. This is a Singapore based position and will report to C&D Leader, ASEAN. How You Will Contribute Project and Resource Management Screen, allocate and monitor projects to ensure optimal resource and expertise assignment. Sets and monitors team project priorities to ensure timely execution. Hands on management of key projects and innovation execution. Execute Project Pipeline – Reactive, Grow, Proactive Innovation and Defensive. Provide regular status updates. Engage management to justify and obtain appropriate resource or expertise. Be a recognized technical resource and expertise leader to customers, sales and marketing, flavorists, product experience, GRA and other departments. Coordinate appropriate resource to support category initiatives and or new concept generation. Fostering, enabling, driving the use of new Innovation and IFF approved materials in flavors to offer IFF proprietary advantage. Effectively deals with ambiguity, moving with changing environment and briefs to ensure teams remain focused and execute accordingly. Manage Capex projects (lab renovation and equipment installation) to ensure timely implementation and smooth execution.

Job_Title: Senior/ Professional Officer (Software Engineering for ML/DL/AI)
Job_Descriptions: Senior/ Professional Officer (Software Engineering for ML/DL/AI) The Professional Officers Division (POD) houses a centralized pool of academic staff under the Professional Officers scheme. Professional Officers come with specialised and deep technical skills acquired through extensive industry experience. They form the talent pool which brings a much-needed industry perspective to student learning. They facilitate applied learning and applied research in SIT, complementing the academic expertise of the faculty to bring industry practices and applications into the curriculum. Professional Officers leverage on their industry experiences to create authentic learning environments, where discovery and innovation take place. They act as coaches and mentors to students during practical learning activities such as laboratory sessions, Capstone Projects and the Integrated Work Study Programme (IWSP). Professional Officers could also lead or work with faculty on industry innovation projects to provide solutions to the industry. In addition to their role in applied learning and applied research, Professional Officers manage the centralised laboratory facilities and resources in SIT. With Technical Officers, laboratory safety professionals, and administrators in POD, they jointly develop central policies and processes for the safe and seamless operation of laboratories in SIT. Closes 31 Dec 2022 Work type Contract Find Out More

Company Overview WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives. Join us. Shape your story here. As Content Strategist, you will be involved in building and designing the creative strategy for branded content campaigns of CNNIC’s advertising partners. With strong storytelling abilities, and working with the Data and Insight teams, you will be delivering creative concepts for clients that add value to the CNN brand, and aimed to provide strong engagement with the CNN audiences. These ideas will be presented to sales, and if required, assist sales in communicating these concepts to clients and related agencies. You will see projects through from initial brief to delivery of final reports. Job Responsibilities: Unpacks client brief and delivers branded content solutions for Japan clients Consults sales team for additional context of client’s objectives Works with Lead Strategist and Data & Insights team for concept development. Works closely with Digital and Film Production Leads for concept development. Produce pitch documents that will include data-driven strategy and content ideas, with an eye for adequate budget allocation.
