Why GSK Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Primary Function You're the type of person who has a passion for taking raw numbers and turning them into actionable insights, be it on customers, markets, competitors and business plan effectiveness, to measure performance and support business decisions. You will have a deep curiosity, a true interest in technology and logistics, and a natural eye for detail. You will work closely with Senior Management in planning and managing various marketing research projects including analysis and interpretation of findings. You are independent and determined, but thrive as part of a team. You enjoy dealing with people, and you're that person who knows what accurate, timely and thorough market intelligence research really means. Main duties and responsibilities: Conduct market intelligence, monthly business reviews, market intelligence scorecard, including taking lead role in consolidating, analyzing and disseminating field intelligence about customers, market developments and brand perception Conduct market studies on leasing and shipping customer competition, sales and trading competition using analysts and consultancies reports. Monitor, review and evaluate new products and services, market and industry trends and developments. Monitor and maintain a database on customer activity, trends and needs. Support in preparation of presentations and material for senior management, including regular reviews on business and various other thematic updates as required Support in industry conferences and trade shows including preparation of advertisements, collateral material, banners, posters, sourcing of corporate gifts. Work with Marketing Director: to monitor and research available market information and prepare Sales Roadmaps, Competitor Analyses, Industry Trend reports, both for shipping industry and other adjacencies To analyze, interpret and summarize multiple data/research sources to devise and implement strategies for Product development, Product Marketing, trade shows. To utilize available research to identify new growth opportunities in products, features and services Assist in building and developing the strategies to target and develop these new growth opportunities and implement them on a project basis. Assist in corporate event planning and management as required Education / Experience Minimum Degree in Business or Marketing. Minimum 3 years of experience in an analytical role involving industry/market and competitor research. Excellent numerical, communication, presentation (including MS Office Suite, especially PowerPoint and Excel) skills, and proficiency in Power BI Highly developed research skills and knowledge of desk research and sources, trade interviewing and a solid understanding of and/or experience in strategy and competitive analysis High level of proficiency in Power BI and other major data visualization and management platforms, as well as fast turnaround of Excel- and PowerPoint-based reports for senior management, are required. A positive attitude with good inter-personal skills Meticulous attention to detail Strong project management, problem solving and analytical skills Strong organizational skills and able to manage and organize large amounts of data Good analytical skills and comfortable with number/data analysis for compilation and analysis Takes initiative and is a self-starter Passionate about solving problems and communicating complex ideas simply and creatively - possess a relentless drive for investigation and connecting the dots. POSITION LOCATION AND REPORTING STRUCTURE: The position will be part of the Wolters Kluwer Asia-Pacific Region Legal team and will report to the Associate General Counsel for the Asia-Pacific Region and Global Growth Markets and work closely with the Tagetik business unit under the direction of the Assistant General Counsel TAA in Europe, who oversees Tagetik's legal operations worldwide. This position will also have a dotted line reporting relationship to the Regional Managing Director of Tagetik. The individual will be located at Tagetik's offices in Singapore - with occasional travel to Tagetik's headquarters in Lucca (Italy) and other Wolters Kluwer locations envisaged. During the COVID-19 period, certain Wolters Kluwer offices may not be open and employees are working remotely. BASIC FUNCTIONS AND PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES: This Legal Counsel will be a member of the Asia-Pacific Region and Tagetik legal teams and will work closely with the senior management team of the Corporate Performance Solutions business unit on customer contracts as well as other general commercial, corporate and contractual matters, and will advise on intellectual property, regulatory compliance and dispute matters. In addition, this role will support other TAA businesses around the world on certain matters, including supporting other global products and negotiations with global customers. The role could also expand to other potential business unit support in the future, if needed. This role would provide primary legal support for East and Southeast Asian countries, including Singapore, Japan, South Korea, Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Thailand and India. Specific accountabilities and responsibilities are expected to include the following: Providing comprehensive legal counseling regarding a broad spectrum of corporate, commercial, and intellectual property matters impacting the businesses, including matters and legal issues related to on-premise / on cloud software and software-related services. Counseling on regulatory and compliance matters impacting the businesses. Providing hands-on legal assistance in structuring and drafting, negotiating, interpreting, managing and enforcing material and high value commercial transactions, including (i) complex, high value customer arrangements (including the preparation of master services agreements and related statements of work) , (ii) partnering, joint venture and strategic alliance arrangements, and (iii) complex and high value licensing and software arrangements (including SaaS services and related implementation agreements), business rules, content or data procurement Wolters Kluwer OVERVIEW: Headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, Wolters Kluwer N.V. is a market-leading global information services company, with 2020 annual revenues of 4.6 billion, more than 19,200 employees worldwide, customers in more than 180 countries and operations in more than 40 countries across Europe, North America, Asia Pacific and Latin America. Wolters Kluwer is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce. The Company's shares are quoted on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. For additional information, see http://www.wolterskluwer.com. Through its four global operating divisions (Tax & Accounting, Legal & Regulatory, Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC), and Health), Wolters Kluwer provides information, tools and solutions that help professionals make their most critical decisions effectively and improve their productivity. The Company operates under well-known brand names such as CCH, CT Corporation, Aspen Publishers, Kluwer Law International, Wolters Kluwer Health, Lippincott, Williams & Wilkins, UpToDate, Ovid, ProVation Medical, Pharmacy OneSource, Health Language, TeamMate, Lexi-Comp, Facts & Comparisons, Medi-Span, Wolters Kluwer Financial Services, Bankers Systems, Gainskeeper, and ARC Logics. Corporate performance solutions & Wolters Kluwer tax & accounting Overview: Corporate Performance Solutions is a business unit within Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting (TAA) that includes two corporate offerings: Tagetik, a corporate performance management solution described in more detail below and TeamMate, an internal audit solution also described in more detail below. TeamMate is the world's most widely-used audit management system, with more than 100,000 auditors at over 2,500 organizations using the solution globally. TeamMate offers a range of easy-to-use and configurable solutions for audit, controls, risk management and analytics. The TeamMate software provides tools for internal audit professionals to manage all aspects of electronic working paper creation and management, risk identification and assessment, control framework management and data analysis. TeamMate is based in the United States and has a global presence with significant client concentrations in all geographies across the globe. TeamMate was acquired by Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting in 2007. In April 2017, Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting acquired Tagetik. Founded in 1986, Tagetik is a market leader in corporate performance management solutions, supporting the workflow of the Office of the CFO, including financial and operational budgeting and planning, consolidation and close process, financial modeling, analytics and reporting. Relied upon by nearly 1,000 corporate customers and 75,000 users in over 35 countries, Tagetik's highly configurable, modular software suite seamlessly integrates with most ERP systems, including SAP, Oracle, and Microsoft. The solution can be deployed on-premise, in the cloud, or in a hybrid manner. Tagetik is based in Lucca, Italy and has subsidiaries located in Canada, France, Germany, Japan, the Netherlands, Singapore, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States and also has affiliates distributing its products in Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia, Hong Kong and China. The Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting global division delivers innovative integrated research and software solutions that provide a strategic business advantage to its customers. Wolters Kluwer TAA holds major market positions in the United States, Canada, Europe and Asia Pacific. Wolters Kluwer TAA holds a leadership position in tax and accounting research and compliance products (including software and workflow products), which are sold to CPAs, corporate tax and accounting departments and tax attorneys. TAA is also a market leader in publishing and content creation for the tax and accounting market. Wolters Kluwer TAA has offices in the United States, Australia, Canada, New Zealand and throughout Europe.

Job_Descriptions: Senior Facilities Coordinator Work Dynamics - Integrated Facilities Management What this job involves: Providing onsite support You will be the upper facilities management’s trusted right hand on all facilities-related activities. You’ll do this by performing routine and ad hoc site inspections to ensure all building processes and best practices are implemented and maintained. You will also be leading headcount discussion and start-to-end move planning and execution for existing and new office spaces. Where can processes be improved? How can we save costs? These are questions that will be at the forefront of the team’s thinking. You, too, will always have an eye on this, contributing suggestions as they arise. You’ll also lend the team a big hand by providing admin support including front desk duties, basic housekeeping and appointment coordination, and vendor management. Also, part of your job scope is to hit key performance indicators and consistently meet service level agreements. Meeting the clients’ facilities needs At JLL, we put client satisfaction at the front and centre of everything we do. If you share our values, we will be more than happy to work with you. In this role, you’ll be responsible for working closely with clients and suppliers onsite to identify their facility-related enquiries and requirements. Your planning and budgeting skills will also be vital to the job, as you’ll take part in the procurement of vendors and services from time to time. Making everyone safe and risk-free Do you value workplace safety? If so, you’ll be a perfect fit for the job. In this role, you will ensure everyone’s health and safety by keeping safe workplace procedures in place and order. You’ll also be expected to carry out these procedures, as needed. At the same time, this role puts you on the first line of defence against risks. As such, you will help implement and manage risk management programs, disaster recovery and business continuity plans. You’ll also be expected to follow escalation and incident reporting procedures, and comply with the firm’s guidelines and strategies. Sound like you? To apply, you need to be a: Passion for service Do you have a prior experience in facilities, property management, hospitality or other related fields? Do you understand local occupational health and safety requirements, critical facilities and vendor management? Are you knowledgeable in various property systems? You are what we’re looking for! Team player JLL’s unmatched excellence is only made possible by team work—a core value we want you to possess. As the facilities coordinator, we expect you to support the team and work well with others toward achieving targets. Likewise, you must have a proven track record of flawless project execution, all while following company standards and procedures. Ensuring that the team practices our ‘I am JLL’ core behaviours is also under your mandate. Client focused enthusiast It is important that you can easily interact with the general client staff and vendors to deliver efficient services. We’ll also count on you to address conflicts and conflicting priorities effectively. Likewise, you must be an excellent and resilient communicator who faces customers with a smile at all times, even when times get rough occasionally. What we can do for you: At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realize your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package. Apply today! Job_Title: Senior Software Engineer – Full Stack (Singapore based)
Job_Descriptions: Senior Software Engineer – Full Stack (Singapore based) Apply Now Share this listing: Singapore About Agoda Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Get to Know our Team: The Full Stack Engineering Department builds the Agoda web and app products. We have several teams in front-end focusing on different aspects of our products including accommodations, flights, payments, marketing, post-booking services, and more. Agoda’s marketplace is the world. We build localized and optimized user experiences at scale on every major internet platform. These include our mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites. We hire people from around the world who have a passion for using technology to create and implement the best user experiences. Our teams work on the full stack and build end-to-end systems including user interfaces, APIs, backend systems, and database systems. Our products are always evolving and under experimentation. We accomplish this by having an amazing degree of automation, CI/CD systems, and use a modularized approach. As we are data driven and measure our results, we continually innovate and improve our work. We are looking for the next great talent who strives to learn and grow and has a standard of excellence, strong sense of ownership, and great technical skills. The Opportunity: We are looking for key contributors to our industry leading front-end websites.  You’ll be working on products which have evolved tremendously over the past several years to become the global market leader. You’ll be using the most current technologies and best practices to accomplish our goals. Our typical day involves the creation of new end to end systems, building advanced architectures, creation of new features on our high uptime / frequently published websites and apps, development of fast and reliable automated testing systems and working in a culture that is always looking to improve our quality, tools, and efficiency. In this Role, you’ll get to: Lead development of features, experiments, technical projects and complex systems Be a technical architect, mentor, and driver towards the right technology Build high volume websites with current technologies including TS, React, and GraphQL Continue to evolve our architecture and build better software Be a major contributor to our agile and scrum practices Get involved with full stack engineering and collaborate with server, other client, and infrastructure technical team members to build the best solution What you’ll Need to Succeed: At least 5 years of experience developing web applications in client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, VueJS, etc. S. in Computer Science or quantitative field; M.S. preferred Working experience with agile, analytics, A/B testing, GIT Flow Excellent HTML/CSS skills – you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too 3-5+ years’ experience developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using one of the backend languages/frameworks such as .NET, .NET Core, Java, Scala, NodeJS, Go or Python. Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack. Great communication and coordination skills Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills You have a good command of the English language. It’s Great if you have: Knowledge in physical architecture at scale, building resilient, no single point of failures, highly available solutions. Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL technologies (CouchBase, ElasticSearch, Redis), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ). Knowledge and hands on experience in CI/CD solutions would be a plus Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript Strong experience in all aspects of client-side performance optimization, Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, Clean Code, SOLID principals, and TDD. Experience in multiple front-end platforms including iOS, Android, Web, and API services Have worked on an app or internet company that is at scale with large numbers of users and transactions per second Have experience in a data driven company with experience analyzing and working with Big Data Lead teams and greenfield projects solving large system problems Worked on global projects serving world markets with distributed data centers and localization of the front end and data #bangkok #sydney #melbourne #toronto #telaviv #kiev #london #moscow #newdelhi #budapest #paris #shanghai #sanfrancisco #singapore #IT #ENG #4 #LI-RS1 Equal Opportunity Employer At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics. We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy. To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

5900BR Enterprise Apps Support Analyst Information technology Singapore - OUE Bayfront Job description Allen & Overy is a leading global law firm operating in over thirty countries. By turning our insight, technology and talent into ground-breaking solutions, we’ve earned our reputation as a firm that leads the industry and opens up new possibilities in law. Joining our global team, you’ll discover what collaborating on a global scale really looks like; you’ll learn how to help drive change; and you’ll be at the heart of an organisation that’s defining the future of law. If you’re ready to find a place to thrive: It’s Time. Department purpose The Technology Services department is responsible for providing world class support and services to our business all across the globe. The IT Service Management team is part of Technology Services, and operates all of the IT services and infrastructure for the firm. Role context and purpose The Senior Enterprise Apps Support Analyst is accountable for implementing Allen & Overy's strategy, architecture, standards and roadmaps in the following areas: On-going support, maintenance and administration of enterprise applications in use within the firm Elite 3e; Intapp suite & Matter workflow system (Open/Wallbuilder/Conflicts/Time/Time Capture); Carpe Diem Support and administration of database platforms in the firm, primarily MS SQL (all versions) and MongoDB Support for all other applications used globally by the firm that are not supported by the DMS and M365 teams, including: SharePoint 2010 on-prem applications; allenovery.com (cloud hosted) Legal Technology apps (non-office based) All other global business applications Support and administration of Dynamics365 platform and applications built on the platform Including packaging, configuration, deployment, patching of software Providing technical expertise for projects where required. The remit of this team is global and extends to all aspects of 3rd line support relating to the infrastructure and services, independent of location. The role involves: Technical delivery of day to day execution in the following areas. Providing a single point of technical leadership on projects (including SIPs and SEs) for technical delivery, leading the technical decision making. Ensuring that services are effectively delivered, understood and supported so that they fulfil business needs. The role holder will be seen as a clear leader for all technical matters relating to their specialist areas The remit of this role is global and extends to all aspects of the product set, independent of location. Providing 3rd line support for the timely resolution of incidents and problems Executing regular maintenance and monitoring tasks End-to-end resolution of incidents, ensuring accurate and timely updates are maintained Responsible for the management and maintenance of systems and services, by ensuring they are fit for purpose and available at all required times. This includes maintaining and optimising applications and infrastructure; and Bringing new releases into production. Being recognised as subject matter experts in the technologies supported by the team Keeping within operational targets; for example ‘problem record’ targets; ‘age of incident’ targets; and ‘backup assurance’. Supporting the firm’s environmental goals and initiatives. Role and responsibilities Architecture & Technology Planning Understand the relevant technology standards and roadmaps Application and Infrastructure Support Works with the Team Leader to ensure effective, seamless support for end users to include: Support of applications and infrastructure; Ensure effective hand-offs between teams; Ensure effective, reliable and efficient end to end processes (internal and external) are in place; Embed continuous improvement and leading by example; Operate within Service and Operational Level Agreements and performance reporting; and Ensure customer satisfaction levels (for example, as reported in the Customer Satisfaction Survey) are maintained and reflect business requirements. Maintain appropriate documentation (including knowledge bases containing known issues /workarounds and support handbooks) for effective 3rd line support Service Delivery Diagnose all incidents/problems escalated to 3rd line support and identify root cause and actions required to maintain or improve service levels Develop implementation plans for dealing with requests for change; evaluate risks to the integrity of the service inherent in proposed implementations; seek authority for those activities; and undertake review of effectiveness of change implementation. Define and deliver continuous improvement programmes, in conjunction with the Team Leader, so that, where applicable, systems deliver a improved performance to the business. Enhancements and improvements to services should be delivered by the appropriate governance authority; and Maintain a culture of continual improvement and problem solving. Build and Implementation Provide specialist guidance information to the Support, Systems Testing and Quality Assurance functions Ensure that documentation and training materials are created and are suitable Risk Management Refer to domain experts for guidance on specialised areas of risk, such as architecture and environment. Key Purpose: The Director, Clinical Data Management, is responsible for delivering data management services to clients and project teams, by management of internal clinical data management and database development staff and clinical data vendors. The Director, Data Management, maintains optimal department processes and implements project-specific strategies, and assists with the development and implementation of department strategies to increase productivity and quality, while decreasing cycle times and costs. The Director, Data Management, provides oversight of project-related data management tasks, including contributing to protocol design; development of project forms to meet project needs; creation, review and finalization of case report forms (CRFs); database design, development and preparation of data validation specifications; and ensuring consistency in database and CRF design, manage coding team. The Director, Clinical Data management, provides oversight of Clinical Data Management and Database Development operations, including hiring personnel, managing personnel matters, and conducting performance evaluations for relevant staff. With the Manager and/or Associate Director, as applicable, the Director, Data Management, provides oversight of training activities to ensure that Clinical Data Management and Database Development personnel receive adequate training to perform job responsibilities. The Director, Data Management, assists with resource allocation and the development of business proposals related to Data Management. The Director, Clinical Data Management provides oversight of project-related data management and database development tasks, and performs project-related tasks, as required. The Director, Data Management, may also serve as the lead Clinical Data Manager on designated projects. As a project lead, the Director, Data Management, maintains a close liaison with client contacts, Project Managers, and other team members to implement the data management aspects of project delivery. Primary Duties + Responsibility: Develop Data management expertise withing the Data and Analytics Domain Work with Clinical Data Managers (CDMs) and Database Developers to routinely monitor project activities against scopes of work to ensure operations are consistent with scope and assist with identifying changes in project scope or efficiencies to maintain timelines and budget. Evaluate and monitor resources and develop resource allocation plan for all projects. In concert with other senior staff, assess staffing and compensation requirements, assist in hiring and ensure appropriate training of Data Management and Database Development personnel. Support the development and implementation of Data Management and Database Development Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), guidelines, policies, procedures and clinical database functional requirements and ensure personnel are trained appropriately. Oversee the implementation and management of data management systems and evaluate process improvements and innovative methods for clinical data management, including Internet-based systems. Interact with clients, as required, to provide a high standard of customer service and ensure complete understanding data management and database development responsibilities. Represent Data Management and Database Development in marketing efforts by developing project bid proposals and performing client presentations as requested. Facilitate communication and promote teamwork among team members. Maintain a good working knowledge of clinical drug development and data management in order to effectively serve as a department resource, develop training materials for Data Management and Database Development personnel, conduct training sessions or otherwise enhance the skills and expand the knowledge of department personnel. Experience & Minimum Requirements: Appropriate educational background and a minimum of 10 years of directly-related clinical data management or related experience and a minimum of 3 years of supervisory experience, to include data management and/or clinical operations. A Bachelor's Degree in a health-related field or Registered Nursing degree would be preferred. Thorough knowledge of International Conference on Harmonisation (ICH) Good Clinical Practice (GCP) guidelines and other applicable regulatory rules and guidelines as well as of medical terminology, clinical trials, and clinical research. Working knowledge of the relationship and regulatory obligation of the contract research organization (CRO) industry with pharmaceutical / biotech companies. Skilled in use of computer technology, including clinical trial databases and applications (e.g., ClinTrial, Inform) and ability to learn new applications. Demonstrated ability to lead by example, and demonstrated skill for technical and supervisory leadership of staff. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills with the ability to work independently and in a team environment. Computational knowledge and knowledge in HEOR, Market access and secondary data would be a plus.

Job Description The Revenue Consultant, Global Revenue Acceleration-JAPAC partners strategically and tactically with Sales Leadership to drive sales productivity and performance in a fast-paced, evolving, very high-growth sales environment. This is a senior, consultative sales strategy and hands-on execution role reporting to the Sr. Director of Global Revenue Acceleration. The focus of this role is to programmatically execute Sales Strategy by leveraging and scaling Sales Planning Motions as a vehicle to accelerate revenue growth, optimize resource leverage, and achieve portfolio sales outcomes. The role develops and drives programs focused on improving selling capacity, sales planning skills and customer growth acumen of complex account management teams. Leveraging the framework of Sales Planning Motions, you will work with account teams and sales leaders in regular selling motion to achieve desired portfolio selling outcomes in our largest accounts. Recent, relevant sales experience is critical to engagement with field teams. Proficient, thoughtful and insightful capacity to conduct and coach through strategic account/deal/opportunity reviews and territory planning is also critical to this role's success. Delivery of these services across sales roles and business units with a customer-centric approach and an eye on diverse portfolio sales outcomes is another measure of success This role is charged with driving optimal execution and collaboration via strategic sales planning, developing effective short and long term action plans in alignment with goals, and to iterate and adjust where necessary to accommodate internal and external change. Responsibilities: Exhibit thought leadership and experience with complex enterprise selling process, methodology, and development Experience in the cybersecurity market and relevant business drivers Possess necessary business acumen to build compelling customer business cases and proposals Experience mapping large enterprise accounts with deep discovery of functional areas, stakeholder alignment, and pathways to connect disparate perspectives toward consensus Apply critical thinking and consultative means to solve challenges and influence without authority Lead ongoing strategic account planning sessions, opportunity reviews, and territory attack strategy discussions to drive creation of short and long-term action plans Lead within and drive intra-team collaboration and thoughtful resourcing Exhibit relationship driven / management consulting approach: create and maintain relationships, rapport and credibility with sales leaders and sales teams to consult and support their goals Leverage and define data and metrics for insight and business impact, making course corrections as needed to achieve desired results Drive application of sales best practices Develop and maintain sales planning and productivity impact reporting with focus on leading indicators of business health as well as growth and bookings outcomes Apply critical thinking, consultative approach, and relationship management across the organization to solve challenges Link EMEA sales and customer success plan to overall PANW transformational initiatives & organizational strategies Participate in key JAPAC sales development programs and forums (Business/Sales Operations functional partnerships, Business Value Consulting engagements, Sales Councils, etc.) Qualifications Recent, relevant, high-performing field sales experience, regional sales leadership or equivalent Cybersecurity industry and relevant business/marketplace drivers experience Demonstrated sales coaching and sales enablement skills and experience Strategic mindset with strong problem solving, analysis, and critical thinking skills Understanding of cybersecurity market and relevant business drivers Experience with complex enterprise sales cycles: portfolio or platform offering Skilled at enabling sales teams to sell broadly into accounts, understand customer business drivers, access and aggregate disparate budget avenues, gain consensus with diverse stakeholders, quantify impact of solutions, etc. Professional sales and experience in a technology sales environment utilizing customer-centric sales approach to align to customer business drivers and long term customer success Drive and lead insightful, motivating facilitation of sales strategy sessions including account planning, territory attack strategy, opportunity level reviews, executive briefings, pre-call plans, etc. Ability to apply financial principles and insight to support teams building economic models and proposals Highly motivated, energetic, collaborative, self-starter who demonstrates leadership, adaptability, flexibility and integrity Executive presence and consultative approach Mentoring/Coaching, Team Management and Leadership Development Experience Ability to facilitate virtually and to travel up to 65% Additional information We're trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity's status quo. Globalization Partners’ automated, AI-enabled global employment platform, designed by our technical teams and powered by our worldwide HR experts, enables our customers to hire, onboard, and manage the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world. As the global employment technology leader, we simplify global business by allowing companies to grow to new countries and test new markets compliantly, without the hassle of setting up branch offices or subsidiaries. With diverse teams all around the world, our people are the heartbeat of the company and the reason why Globalization Partners is a fun and inclusive place to work. We encourage and support personal growth and career development, trust our team members with the autonomy to do their best work, and believe in recognition for a job well done. Did we mention you can experience all of this while working remotely? As a remote-first employer, we value your experience and skills more than where you are located. Join our collaborative work environment where you can make a real impact and love the work you’re doing! About the position: At Globalization Partners we’re in high-growth mode- we've doubled in size this year and plan to continue this pace for the next five years. Given our aggressive charter, we’re looking for a Partner Manager for our Private Equity Program who thrives in a fast-paced environment. We know that Alliances and Partnership strategy will be the key part of our future growth and we believe that the PE program will be one of the major focal points of that strategy.  Growth is in our mandate, and we need people to do it.  Our culture is renowned, and our goal is to build it and keep it! Private Equity owned firms appear to have a clear need for our services, either when they are acquired as a carve out/Spin-off, or as they grow and look to expand outside of their home country. Majority of our current clients are portfolio companies of PE/VC firms, yet most of the PE firms themselves are unaware of our value. The goal of this position would be to develop strong long-term relationships at the PE firm level by creating Service/Pricing Agreements for them and their portfolio companies. What you'll do: Manage the channel strategy to maximize the flow of partners from PE and VC firms Be aware of and work toward overall GP growth strategy and use all vehicles to identify & secure relationships with potential partners - Outbound calls, M&A/PE networking events, association events, social media, personal contacts, etc. Follow the strategic partner strategy, including cooperative alignment, product and integration strategy Build pipeline within the portfolio companies of the PE firms and manage or oversee the revenue base coming from those relationships Work and align with Finance, Legal, Product and Sales to execute PE strategy Support sales by driving and establishing connections at the PE firm level Work and align with HCM Partners, Consultants and PE ecosystem Meet or exceed assigned quota for PE generated business Provide a quarterly update to your business plan Engages PE firms at the senior level and helps to select and pursue opportunities with maximum potential. Promote and train PE firms and Portfolio Companies on value of GP Solution Align with Marketing and Sales Operations on PE Campaigns and overall Marketing Plan What we're looking for: Minimum 10-15 years of Sales/Service experience preferably in HCM or Private Equity Good understanding of the Private Equity/Venture Capital Space Good Negotiation Skills Experience in managing a partner relationship A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent Someone with a charismatic and engaging personality who knows how to get things done. Highly organized, detail-oriented and possess excellent analytical skills Outstanding listening, communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills An entrepreneurial spirit, passionate about what you do, enthusiastic, self-motivated with a strong work ethic Disciplined approach to daily activity planning, setting goals and achieving success Ability to take direction, be coached and mentored A strong phone presence with a knack for building rapport quickly and establishing trust Comfortable having difficult/uncomfortable conversations The ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively. About Globalization Partners Globalization Partners is the world’s leading global employment platform that makes it fast and easy for employers to hire anyone, anywhere, without having to set up international branch offices or subsidiaries. By using Globalization Partners’ proprietary, AI-enabled, automated, and compliant platform, companies can grow revenue faster, improve their access to global talent, and minimize risk. Customers receive around the clock access to the industry’s largest and most experienced team of global HR experts who can assist with questions about hiring talent in over 187 countries. Globalization Partners: Succeed Faster.

Job_Title: Inside Global Account Manager Telco APJ
Job_Descriptions: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 Enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace. Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today. The VMware Global Account Program serves approximately 100 of VMware's largest customers. These premier accounts are managed by a team of experienced Global Account Managers (GAM) with the objective to establish a significant VMWare footprint in the largest and most influential corporations worldwide. Our selling is focused on our customers primary business initiatives and connecting our value to our customers business value. Our Value Selling strategy is the investment of time, talent and technology from VMWare and our partners to invent (transform) our customers business for their benefit. The Inside Sales Global Account Manager (iGAM) role supports the sales efforts our Global account program and resides within our Inside Sales organization. The Inside Sales organization is a fast-paced demand generation engine responsible for driving incremental growth for the VMWare sales organization. We're looking for people who love to win, have strong business ethics and great communication skills. If you have the ambition to learn new technologies, drive sales, and deliver results, this may be the role for you. Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing The iGAM supports multiple global accounts WWwith accountability on the sub $250K business in conjunction with strong teaming and collaboration skills and the ability to leverage and share best practices across accounts. The role commands an understanding of the aligned GAMs account strategyand working closely with all remote teams WW. The iGAM prospects, generates, qualifies, quotesand follows up on assigned leads and campaigns and coordinates accurate and timely home and landed updates on pipeline and forecast. The role requires the ability to leverage disparate teams within VMware to support the GAM or GAEin the presentation of a strategic and/or tactical proposal (e.g., IB renewals, etc.). The iGAM must be proficient in sales tools, have the ability to Lead relevant product campaigns (e.g., VMC) and provide coverage where landed resources aren't available and/or effective. The Work: What type of work will you be doing What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis Accountable for driving business, and meeting or exceeding quota goals, in an assigned territory. Responsible for all duties from prospecting to closing accounts, in partnership with the outside Global Account Manager. Prospect, generate, qualify and follow up on assigned leads. Provide accurate and timely updates on pipeline and forecast utilizing SalesForce. Articulate the full range of VMware technologies, products, and services and identify how these products and services align to customer needs. Communicate technical, industry, and market facts to position VMware as a competitive solution with customers. Collaborate with colleagues, cross-functionally (Outside Global Account Managers, Client Solutions Director, Channel Partners, Marketing, etc.), to support the sales strategy. Maintain in-depth product, industry trend, and technical knowledge. Ability to speak business level English & Japanese, Chinese preferable What is the leadership like for this role What is the structure and culture of the team like Our team looks for candidates who embody our EPIC2 values - Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers and Community. Team members who are logically curious, interpersonal, customer focused and able to find the humor in situations tend to thrive at VMware and embody the following traits . Self-motivated with a high attention to detail and ability to multitask. . Some experience using Salesforce. . An unwavering positive attitude, strong drive for results, and the ability to deal with ambiguity. . Thrives working with others in a team environment. . Ability to think strategically and adjust to meet business needs. Comfortable managing entire sales cycle from start to finish . Open to receiving and acting on feedback to improve results. Demonstrates good judgment in analyzing information to make decisions. Where is this role located Flexible: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from a local VMware office and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager. You will be expected to live within a reasonable non-daily commute of the office. Job_Title: Head of Enterprise Strategy and Operations
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary AWS is one of Amazon's fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. AWS customers include some of the most innovative startups like Netflix, Pinterest, Spotify, Airbnb, and Instagram as well as some of the largest global enterprises like Shell International, Unilever, Hitachi, Sharp, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Samsung. We help global and local enterprises to use cloud to remediate their legacy technology and build new innovative businesses. In this role, the Head of Sales Strategy Operations and Enablement (SSOE) will develop and execute the strategy, continuously evolve forecasting models, analyze historic results and be a trusted partner to the APJ Enterprise Director making recommendations based on those analyses - all in an environment of hyper-scaling growth and increasing complexity. As a member of the APJ Enterprise leadership team, this role will be working with regional and global AWS leaders across multiple functions to develop, implement and manage the business processes, systems, reports and strategies that optimize Business functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives. The role will drive the management cadence of the business including mechanisms such as OP1/2 2x2 and weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting. The role drives improvements and updates to the reporting tools, methods, and processes utilized by the team to increase the availability and granularity of actionable data for our customers. This position also manages the proposal, administration and execution of the regional targets and goals, headcount plans, including market segmentation and proposing improvements to the business to increase its effectiveness in driving desired results. This role leads a large, multi-layered organization that spans 11 countries and direct reporting functions include operations, sales strategy, sales incentive and customer and sales enablement teams. Business Intelligence, Business Development, Finance, Human Resources, Marketing, Recruiting, and Compensation teams are critical extended stakeholder teams. The successful candidate will be an excellent organizational and people leader, who can hire and develop the best talent across their organization including coaching and developing senior direct reports. They will be a superb written and verbal communicator. They will be comfortable presenting to the senior AWS leadership and influencing regional and global stakeholders across the Sales organization. They will be able to see round corners by identifying critical internal and external trends, they will be detail orientated, with a passion for inventing and simplifying to deliver operational excellence at scale. They will work backwards from their internal and external customers, they will be able to roll-up their sleeves working directly with models and data as well as ideating and driving strategic priorities for the region. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field . 15+ years experience in strategy consulting or strategy roles in a large-scale hi-tech companies. . Experience leading large, complex organizations. . Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tool utilized for CRM, sales compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting, sales force automation . Expert level in Excel and Data query tools . Strong business-process design experience . Exhibits sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results . Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly . Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Experience in Asia Pacific and Japan . MBA, PHD or other relevant advanced degree. . Deep expertise and familiarity with cloud product and services, and sales cycles. . Proficiency with annual forecasting and planning and related 3rd party tools. . Having presented to C-level executives (CIO, CEO, CTO, CISO, etc.) as well as to technical subject matter experts. What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon Web Services Talent Acquisition's Global Talent Intelligence (AWS TA GTI) Program is seeking a Talent Intelligence Leader based in Singapore. The AWS TA GTI Program's mission is to accelerate the process of finding builders of all backgrounds using research and insights to enable Amazon Web Services Talent Acquisition (AWS TA) Teams to reach their strategic goals and AWS business partners to make informed talent decisions. The AWS GTI Program aims to be a force multiplier of talent for AWS TA by empowering recruiters and sourcers with research and talent intelligence in order to create efficient talent strategies for today and cultivate talent pools to support our growth tomorrow. OVERVIEW The Senior Talent Intelligence Lead will be aligned to an AWS TA Team (or Teams) and will be responsible for leading and running a market and talent intelligence program that is unique to each team(s) respective AWS lane-of-business. AWS TA Team(s) and their respective lanes-of-business may span a variety of geographies with differing strategic goals and business requirements. The Senior Talent Intelligence Lead will leverage data to work backwards from each customer's specific needs and create bespoke solutions to close gaps across a variety of talent initiatives. This role assists customers by looking around corners to solve current problems and create solutions that generate results at scale. The Senior Talent Intelligence Lead will leverage a combination of global talent market and industry research as well as internal talent data to provide customers with valuable talent and market insights. This role works closely with recruitment teams and leaders at all levels to deliver relevant data and proposals that influence recruiting strategies. RESPONSIBILITIES The role is responsible for defining each program through data analysis that creates unique research projects that influences talent strategies and resource allocation within GTI's mission, vision, and tenets. Overall role responsibilities include: . Partner with hiring teams that stakeholders at all levels to understand organizational challenges and build work products that fit into a comprehensive end-to-end recruitment strategy . Participate in strategic business engagement with a focus on effectively defining a targeted passive candidate sourcing strategy across multiple job profiles within a designated national region, country, or countries . Provide recommendations as a talent researcher and sourcing subject matter expert that directly impact front-of-funnel activities . Define a profile-based sourcing strategy across a variety of different AWS business segments . Drive competitive intelligence research and analysis through various internal and external tools . Map talent and competitive intelligence through qualitative and quantitative research, and present insights in a compelling way that influences action . Effectively communicate with key stakeholders to build influence and ensure application of research products with the correct customers . Evaluate effectiveness of research over time via feedback loops or key metrics unique to each business, and adjust approaches as needed . Use funnel metrics which impact the business to drive actions and anticipate bottlenecks then proactively work backwards from the customer to produce research collateral that eliminates those bottlenecks . Independently Analyze and draw conclusions from a mix of quantitative and qualitative data and implement changes with your program as a result . Manage, prioritize, and close searches against timelines and set benchmarks, metrics to understand how to prioritize sourcing strategies to hit customer SLAs . Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within AWS's mission to deliver the highest quality results for the customers . Share best practices with recruitment teams and partner cross-functionally with other AWS TA Teams to create processes that impact positive candidate engagement . Successfully write narratives that are both project based (deliverables, timelines, formal tracking processes, etc.) and program based tailored to the audience in order to maximize impact and understanding . Develop and lead special projects that have an AWS TA Wide that impact at scale . Amply your customers voices with a data-driven approach during AWS TA organizational discussions to ensure their businesses unique challenges are represented in the decision making process . Influence and educate peers regarding research and sourcing best practices that lead to successful outcomes throughout AWS TA and Amazon TA BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional or military experience . 5+ years in recruiting, sourcing, program or project management, research, or consulting experience for a global corporate entity with a high hiring bar . 3+ years of experience creating market mapping and talent intelligence tools . 2+ years of building and managing the lifecycle of complex cross-functional programs or projects with considerable country or global impact . Experience with defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements in the talent identification process . Comprehensive understanding of the recruitment life cycle with particular expertise in both passive and active sourcing recruitment strategies . Proficient Excel skills (running and creating functions, pivot tables, charts, etc.) that enables the extraction and processing of data . Comfortable identifying passive candidates through 3P identification tools (LinkedIn Recruiter, Entelo, SeekOut, etc.) and pioneering experimental candidate identification methods (Google X-Ray Searches, event based sourcing, social media, etc.) . CTS/ATS experience with sourcing, tracking and managing candidates . As you will be conducting Talent Intelligence research for the Japan market and business, proficiency in Japanese language is a must. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Excellent communication skills, paired with sound business judgment and ability to cultivate relationships with stakeholders/customers at all organizational levels . Excels in an ambiguous environment while consistently delivering the right results with limited guidance under aggressive deadlines against multiple projects at one time . Customer obsessed, proactively working backwards from the customers current or anticipated needs to create bespoke solutions to close process gaps . Self-starting, entrepreneurial spirit with understanding of how to use data and calculated risk-taking to drive innovative change . Experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, QuickSight, Salesforce etc.) Here at Amazon - . We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. . Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. . Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Responsibilities: Leads kitchen team in chef's absence Provides guidance to junior kitchen staff members, including, but not limited, to line cooking, food preparation, and dish plating Oversees and organizes kitchen stock and ingredients Ensures a first-in, first-out food rotation system and verifies all food products are properly dated and organized for quality assurance Keeps cooking stations stocked, especially before and during prime operation hours Helps train new kitchen employees to restaurant and kitchen standards Manages food and product ordering by keeping detailed records and minimises waste, plus works with existing systems to improve waste reduction and manage budgetary concerns Supervises all food preparation and presentation to ensure quality and restaurant standards Works with head chef to maintain kitchen organization, staff ability, and training opportunities Verifies that food storage units all meet standards and are consistently well-managed Assists head chef with menu creation Coordinates with restaurant management team on supply ordering, budget, and kitchen efficiency and staffing Requirements: Knowledge of applicable safety and sanitation procedures Knowledge of food cost, inventory management and purchasing Must have excellent communication and leadership skills, Must be able to perform effectively as a team player Must be able to perform and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Experience in personnel management and problem-solving skills Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends
