Job_Title: Mindshare | Senior Director Performance Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at Mindshare You will be the key POC for APAC client and point of escalation for the 4 Local markets. You will lead the client relationship while also being responsible for maintaining the quality of contracted services, lobbying additional assignments as well as developing appetite for and building revenues from out-of-scope offerings and value add services. As Performance Director, you will be tasked with supporting management for the profitable and efficient running of the account through retention of talent, streamlining & implementing processes and systems across the portfolio. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Chief Performance Officer 3 best things about the job: You would be at the forefront of the media industry at the largest, most awarded media agency in the region Working with a fun and dynamic team of performance specialists from various backgrounds and experience You would be driving forward initiatives for Mindshare, on a world-leading Regional client Measures of Success: Responsible for the delivery of best in class performance & ecommerce strategies for L’Oréal across all regional markets, account audits and development of new strategical products and service Partner with Analytics counterparts to understand, and make best use of client’s internal data sources to develop new methods to grow their Performance Channels Develop robust testing program, to contribute to regional learnings and incrementally grow the digital channels Collaborate with internal stakeholders to deliver a regional roadmap for L’Oreal Responsible for hitting the Performance KPIs for all brands which works to prove the value of biddable platforms to the clients and internal teams Provide centralized repository for continuous learning and knowledge sharing Seek out new revenue streams through existing and new clients, spending time with stakeholders within the business to promote consultancy services Responsibilities: Be the key business owner and driver for L’Oréal Performance Hub Provide thought leadership and identify and evaluate industry best practices for implementation for L’Oréal SEA markets Performance excellence across markets Provide insights into end-to-end performance and ROI analysis from a regional perspective to be cascaded to local markets Provide performance management results and actionable insights to regional stakeholders through ongoing communication leveraging strong data visualization, storytelling, and clearly articulated learnings Using data and analytics for decision making and measuring marketing effectiveness as well as creating a culture of structured experimentation and iteration to drive growth Provide leadership on the development of strategic Ecommerce/Digital plans and set up growth drivers with a clear roadmap to successful execution. Drive share gains in e-commerce to drive towards leadership and new recruitment. Responsible for driving full funnel performance marketing mindset through creation & implementation of playbooks Lead and develop full cross functional team supporting e-commerce and digital activation, infusing digital expertise into everything the team does. Collaborate with Local markets, clients and other stakeholders to obtain buy-in, optimize plans and escalate/resolve issues from creation, execution and post launch learnings in digital marketing. Drive the effectiveness of precision media across key brands supporting with campaign design, technologies and agency partners. Maximize spend by brand while optimizing profits – work with agencies to understand opportunities that drive customers recruitment and conversion. Provide expertise on current Ecommerce industry best practices. Consult on cross-functional projects to ensure Ecommerce principles are incorporated and are true to the desired brand and consumer experience. Create & cascade platform best practices across markets What you will need: Minimum 10-12 years’ work experience in strategic planning or performance planning role with 6-8 years experience in digital media – ideally search or performance Media agency experience optional but working knowledge of media planning is needed. Highly evolved presentation and facilitation skills. Experience in managing large projects. The ability to manage multiple stakeholders, prioritize and lead proactively. This role requires someone who can roll up their sleeves and get involved to make a difference. Shows a depth of understanding of the industry, business, brands and consumers in client conversations. Understands business principles and good practice and perceives issues in both financial and commercial terms. Must be strong at problem-solving and/or firefighting on digital technology issues. Act as the digital sounding board across markets especially for major campaign launches Experience of managing people, driven and tenacious individual, with leadership qualities A methodical, organized approach to work About GroupM GroupM leads and shapes media markets by delivering performance enhancing media products and services, powered by data and technology. Our global network agencies and businesses enable our people to work collaboratively across borders with the best in class, providing them the opportunity to accelerate their progress and development. We are not limited by teams or geographies; our scale and diverse range of clients let us be more adventurous with our business and talent. We give our talent space, support and tools to innovate and grow. As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in. Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com About Mindshare Mindshare, the global media agency network, and part of WPP, the largest marketing communications network in the world, has more than 7,000 employees, in 116 offices across 86 countries. Mindshare APAC has won over 300 awards in 2014/2015 and was the most awarded agency at the 2015 Campaign Asia Awards Festival. Mindshare was also recognised as the SMARTIES™ APAC ‘Agency Network of the Year 2015’ for the third consecutive year. Mindshare is also home to The 2015 Festival of Media Asia Pacific Rising Star – Jason Maggs. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com

Job_Title: Mindshare | Account Executive, Content+ Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at Mindshare Overview of job Mindshare is seeking an account executive to join Mindshare Content+, a specialist unit responsible for developing creative content across all clients. We require a candidate with a passion for creative thinking, with a flexible attitude and open mind. The role requires a strong focus on strategy, ideation, and production expertise with client relationship management. Sitting within a media agency, we strive to ensure that insights and data are at the heart of all our social and content campaigns, not only creating great content but ensuring it’s seen by the right audience at the optimum time. Reporting of the role: This role reports to the Head of Content+ Singapore 3 best things about the job: A fun environment that combines the best of being entrepreneurial whilst at the same time being part of an award-winning global media agency network and the largest marketing services group in the world Working within an established award-winning team with access to a strong regional network of over 300 content specialists and multiple strategic partners that help bring to life inspired and provocative branded experiences and content for our client’s audiences. A revenue-driving role where you will constantly be inspired and challenged to be original and have light-bulb moments that you’re able to actualize and integrate working with various teams and specialist units within the agency. Key responsibilities: Creative Ideation and Execution To manage & actively participate in ideation and brand social posts creation by working with the creative team to produce both static and interactive formats (GIF, Slideshow, Carousel, video etc) for social brands To facilitate wider Content-relevant projects that’s an extension of social including Influencer and content partner management, app production, video production & activation support where needed from brief to conceptualisation & delivery of project Content Creation and Planning Research on latest trends and developments in social media and content space to keep wider team and clients updated Assist in planning social content calendars for brands from a day-to-day management perspective e.g. from receiving campaign briefing to conceptualising the current posts that is required based on scope to final delivery and scheduling on social Client Servicing Assist in day to day servicing of accounts by liaising with client on approval and revisions of monthly content calendars Social and Content Reporting – Regular monthly analysis and reporting of social channel and content performance Work with social management tools like Locowise and SocialBakers to publish, retrieve and schedule content. For ad hoc projects – a comprehensive post-campaign report and recommendations + learnings would be produced in conjunction with partner Community Management for Social – Assist with responding to queries and comments from fans on social pages and update FAQ library. To keep client updated with any complex issues and trouble-shoot issues as brand custodian. Measures of success: In three months: You will have been exposed to current and past content projects to understand the campaign and pitch process. You will be up to speed with the value proposition on Mindshare Content+ and will be able to articulate this confidently. You will have started to manage social and content projects from developing content calendar strategy based off brand-related campaigns, to working with the social client(s) on community management-related queries. You will have started to build relationships with the key decision makers within the current pipeline. In six months: You will be well-versed to manage social/content projects independently as the lead community manager. You will be in the known on social & digital trends and share this expertise with clients and internal partners. You will have started to cultivate relationships with existing Content+ partners and support our team to deliver on other projects, including – content & influencer management, creative production, activations, sponsorship opportunities. In twelve months: You will have started to close other existing opportunities beyond social, including content partnerships and activation with a strong focus on strategy and creative content/production expertise. You will have a proven track record of being the go-to brand custodian for your accounts and a trusted partner that clients seek advice and consult from. You will identify new partners for Content+ as part of a client brief and for initiatives. Required skills & traits: Studies in Mass Communications, Communications & New Media, Digital Media, Digital Marketing, Journalism or English. Being flexible, open to innovations and ideas Excellent English writing skills. Proficiency in other languages is a plus. Active and savvy on various Social Media platforms and project management Good at multitasking More about Mindshare We were born in Asia in 1997, a start up with a desire to change the media world. Now we are a global agency with more than 7,000 employees in 116 offices across 86 countries, operating as one team - #teammindshare. We believe that in today’s world, everything begins and ends in media. We aim to be our clients’ lead business partner, to grow their business, and drive profitability through adaptive and inventive marketing. We do this through speed, teamwork and provocation and by operating as a network of networks rather than a rigid hierarchy. We create new things and have fun doing it. Whenever and wherever you join us, you open a door to opportunities in any and of all aspects of media, technology and innovation. We will support you, recognize you and reward you, making Mindshare the place where you do the best work of your career. Mindshare APAC has won 500 awards in the last year alone, including “Agency Network of the Year 2017” by both the MMA SMARTIES™ and Campaign Asia for the fifth and third consecutive year, respectively. Mindshare is part of GroupM, the media investment management arm of WPP, the world’s leading communications services group. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com and follow us on Twitter @mindshare and facebook.com/mindshareapac and linkedin.com/company/mindshare. About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners. As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in.

DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 150 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world-including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies-to power their infrastructure. The SMB APJ segment team is one of the most exciting, fast moving and diverse customer segment within AWS. Our role is to build programs and mechanisms across Sales, Partner and Marketing to support our Partners and SMB field teams to build, innovate and simplify for our customers and we believe Digital Innovation will be one such program for us to achieve our goal. Amazon's approach to innovation continues to be the subject of great customer interest amongst C-suite and Line of Business (LoB) executives - resonating with customers across all industries, segments, and stages of cloud adoption. AWS Digital Innovation team helps us engage with business leaders by introducing customers to Amazon's peculiar customer-centric approach to innovation through topics like working backwards, culture of innovation, digital transformation etc., and bringing the resultant ideas to life demonstrating the breadth, depth, and agility of AWS technology. AWS is looking for a candidate who believes in the potential of transforming the SMB landscape in APJ using the power of technology. Despite being an APJ role, the BDM will not only be expected to work with the APJ team but also collaborating with and learning from the global and regional teams to make this program a success. There will be high levels of interactions with the global and other regional teams in your day-to-day work for purposes of knowledge sharing and building synergies. As a APJ SMB Business Development Manager (BDM) for Digital Innovation. your primary responsibility will be to lead and develop various engagements with line-of-business leaders and executives leaders of SMBs inspired by Amazon mechanisms like Working Backwards, including facilitating executive round tables, running workshops to identify customer's problems and needs, and presenting in large scale forums. In addition, you will use your experience to help improve our engagement model and develop localized and impactful Digital Innovation engagement models. The ability to engage our stakeholders effectively with a combination of business and technical knowledge and forming meaningful relationships with them is key to the success for this role and for this program. Key job responsibilities * Conduct customer briefings, present at customer events, further AWS solutions-led thought leadership in the digital innovation domain and work with Marketing team to create content for these presentations * Conceptualize content and facilitate workshops / discussions with groups of SMB business executives and develop C-suite and line-of-business relationships with leading innovators within customer organizations * Deliver and lead engagements with business leaders of high priority SMBs to identify specific end-customer problems or opportunities and work with various internal teams to articulate AWS role for them * Lead and coordinate translation of those solutions into working cloud prototypes, working with relevant engineering and services teams, and partners where appropriate * Develop localized and impactful Digital Innovation engagement models based on SMB engagement experience and learnings from working across the region * Capture learnings and share knowledge effectively across APJ and WW teams and stakeholders * Handle a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market * Train & enable local sales teams to help qualify customers and understand Digital Innovation * Effectively track and articulate the value of engagements underway, and major wins * Work with the Partner team to identify, engage and enable partners who can accelerate our approach to digital innovation * Work with sales leadership to identify and qualify customers for the Digital Innovation program BASIC QUALIFICATIONS * The right person will be technical and analytical, and possess significant experience of business development enterprise sales, or program/product management experience. * 7+ years of experience in customer-facing digital innovation or equivalent consultative sales role * 7+ years of business development, consulting, program/product management, or IT solutions development experience * Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills. Experience in working with C level executives in SMB organizations, understanding of the way SMB organizations work, their decision making processes and how to create value for them * Operational excellence mind-set and experience. Data driven. Excellent problem-solving skills. Adept at simplifying complexity and developing scalable propositions * Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities * Education - BA or above required additional qualifications in relevant areas highly desired PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS * 10+ years of relevant work experience in SMB markets . Breadth and depth in multiple industry markets and industry ecosystems. * Good understanding of public and hybrid cloud platforms, and the technologies customers are using to drive and deliver digital innovation * Ability to multitask and manage portfolio of projects - work prioritization, planning, collaboration, and management * Strong business and financial acumen and negotiations skills * Deep knowledge of Amazon leadership principles and innovation mechanisms * Published thought leadership in digital transformation or cloud technology topics relatable to SMBs * Good working knowledge of AWS Services - especially higher level services that are the focus of customer innovation (AI/ML, IoT, etc.) * Experience with user experience, service design, design thinking or related * Experience with training, enablement and accreditation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION Partner Leader, Health Care and Life Sciences (HCLS), Global Accounts (BDSI) Would you like to lead a team that is redefining the IT industry Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a candidate to lead and manage our partnerships with management consulting firms and leading global and regional systems integrators. Do you have the business savvy and industry expertise necessary to position Amazon as the technology platform of the future As a Partner Leader within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share to help our Global customers accelerate their journey to the cloud. The Partner Leader will lead the Partner Strategy for the HCLS vertical with a team of senior Partner Success Managers. The Partner team ensures that: 1) customers and sales teams understand the value of partners and how to engage 2) a strategic plan is created for each account 3) partners have brand awareness and drive new customer demand 4) qualified partners are recommended for opportunities and deliver quality results and 5) partners know what is required for success in the industry. The successful leader will possess a technology sales and/or partner sales management background where they have demonstrated success in leading a customer-obsessed team that achieves its goals via a matrixed sales team environment. Further, they will have a demonstrated aptitude for hiring, training and developing the best to create a highly-effective and scalable team. They will be highly-motivated with demonstrated capabilities in defining and driving operational excellence within their team, well-defined plans that include features enabling quick identification of issues or successes, and the ability to spot trends that help our customers, partners and AWS succeed in their mutual goals. Roles & Responsibilities: Field Leadership: Operate as the single threaded owner of all activities, escalations and partner-led impact for the HCLS industry vertical. Performance Management: Maintain a high bar and ensure that expected contributions are delivered by the team, through ongoing coaching, feedback and development planning. Operational Excellence: Able to meet or exceed all operational aspects of the role to ensure team success. Further, the successful leader will have the Amazon Leadership Principle of Invent and Simplify as part of their operational tool kit and be able to identify opportunities to increase effectiveness and efficiency. Market Assessment for assigned territory: Assess the most effective use of partner's resources and drive operating models with sales and functional teams. Sales Contribution: Provide scale and increased sales capacity by leveraging the partner community to drive increased usage of AWS services through the development and execution of both sell-through and sell-with models. Project Delivery and Customer Success: Ensure that ongoing partner engagements are delivered to exceed customer expectations. Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work. Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . 5+ years management experience leading direct or partner sales . 5+ years knowledge and experience of the HCLS Sector . 7+ years partner sales, business development and partner management experience . Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives . Experience of working with Global Accounts . Exposure of working with Systems Integrators, Consulting Companies, and ISV's to drive sales . Possess presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . 7+ Years prior direct sales experience . Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics . Experience and familiarity with the AWS platform, products, solutions and capabilities . Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role . Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Job_Title: Senior Solutions Architect, ASEAN Public Sector
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary AWS is where innovation, risks, and ideas are celebrated. We are builders, we try new things, and imagine big dreams. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers. Come join us and work with the latest cloud technologies that enable our customers to adopt cloud based solutions. ABOUT THE TEAM This role is part of the ASEAN Public Sector team. As part of the team, you will work with our customers based out of our Singapore office. You will focus on the public sector, where you will work directly with customers from various government agencies, educational institutions, and non-profit organisations across all stages of their cloud journey. THE ROLE You will collaborate with customers, partners and other AWS teams to craft architectures, proof of concepts or demonstrations of our platform that work back from customer's business needs and accelerate the adoption of appropriate AWS technology. You will help shape and design solutions covering a spread of domains from migration of core enterprise applications to working with AI/ML, microservices, containers, app development, IoT to name a few. The ability to learn new technology and develop industry relevant architectures and convey business value is critical to the role. Building relationships to understand our customers is key. As a trusted technical advisor, you'll use your interpersonal skills to influence a variety of stakeholders from technical teams to executives. You'll help ensure their short-term technology decisions are aligned with their long-term goals. Speeding up the adoption of our services will be part of your day to day. You'll also act as an evangelist in the wider community. This includes taking part in educating, sharing best practices, presenting at events, writing white papers, blogs, and running workshops. You won't just want to be part of an industry movement you'll want to be leading it. As a Builder, you'll also have the chance to shape the direction of our products and services. This is through gathering feedback from customers whilst collaborating with our engineering and service teams. Want to find out what it's like to be a Solution Architect at AWS Watch this video (https://bit.ly/3keYcC9). What if I don't meet all the requirements That's okay! We hire people who have a passion for learning and are curious. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. Your onboarding will set you up for success, including a combination of formal and informal training. You'll also have a chance to gain AWS certifications and access mentorship programs. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we don't mind being called peculiar. We see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox. We believe in removing obstacles so builders can build which is why our people enjoy working in AWS. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Want to Come Build the Future with us Don't wait, apply today! BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . Background in any other following or related to Technology Architect, Consultant, Cloud Architect, Technical Lead, Software Developers, Engineering Lead, Sales Engineer, Pre Sales Engineer or Systems Engineers, etc. . Will have experience and/or deeper understanding in one or more technology areas. Specific knowledge in multiple technology domain areas (e.g., software development, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics). . Can create proof of concepts, demos, and/or scripts from scratch or leveraging reusable components. . Understands and can articulate common architectural patterns and design principles . Can take the lead on a complex technical project, which may require the participation of other teams to deliver. . Able to create technical content that is easily adopted and reusable by others. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Experience architecting, migrating or transforming customer requirements to the cloud . Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS . One or more AWS certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate . Demonstrated thought leadership through public speaking and / or publications #aws-sgp-pubsec-ap

DESCRIPTION Job summary Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a dynamic results oriented candidate to join as the Partner Sales Manager, Emerging Markets within our ASEAN Partner team. As the Partner Sales Manager within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon's utility computing web services (including Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, Amazon CloudFront, Amazon RDS) within the portfolio of partners and solution providers. Your broad responsibilities will include helping to define and execute against the partner program for Emerging Markets, establishing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these organizations in order to build long-term business and marketing opportunities. The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CXO/VP level, as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions. Other responsibilities include: . Serve as a key member of the ASEAN team in helping to drive the overall AWS partner strategy in Emerging Markets (Cambodia, Pakistan and other emerging countries) . Have a broad based understanding of cloud technologies . Develop a group of committed partners including a plan to recruit, on-board, educate and measure them in Emerging Markets . Develop and execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales, marketing, legal, support, etc.). . Work with specific prospects/partners to develop the business value proposition for using our services and solutions for the specific prospects/partners educate and enable them for using AWS solutions . Establish the business development pipeline by engaging with prospects and key customers . Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress against budgeted plan and any potential roadblocks to closing new customers . Manage complex contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal group . Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of the market strategy . Handle ad-hoc incoming inquiries and qualify them as potential AWS BD targets. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . The right person will have a balance of technical and analytical background possess extensive sales, Channels and/or business development experience. . Degree/MBA in relevant disciplines with at least ten years of working knowledge of software development tech companies. . Extensive channel and alliance experience in Emerging Markets is an essential requirement to be successful in this role. . Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Experience working within the software industry is highly desired, especially in the virtualization, cloud or software spaces. . Exposure to and experience is developing channel programs to deliver sustainable revenue. . Culturally aware and have good interpersonal skills able to collaborate across different functional teams and internal stakeholders. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job_Title: MediaCom | Regional Planning Manager Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at MediaCom ABOUT MEDIACOM We believe in People First, Better Results. MediaCom unleashes brands’ growth by helping them See the Bigger Picture. This means that we apply our unique ‘Systems Thinking’ philosophy and technology to all marketing levers: media, message and data. As a result, we design communication strategies that deliver short term results and help brands build for the future. As part of WPP, the world's largest marketing communications services group, and GroupM, WPP’s consolidated media investment management arm, we have access to the richest data, most robust benchmarks and most advanced capabilities in the market. This helps us provide comprehensive solutions to all marketing challenges. Our success is underpinned by our long-standing ‘People First, Better Results’ belief. We know that by investing in our people’s whole-person wellbeing, careers and capabilities, we will help grow our clients’ businesses. In 2020 this approach led MediaCom to be crowned Global Media Network of the Year by Eurobest and Festival of Media Global, in addition to being the most awarded agency at the WARC Media Awards. MediaCom is one of the world’s leading media communications specialists, with billings of US$17.6 billion (Source: COMvergence, 2020), employing 8,000 people in 125 offices across 100 countries. Its global client roster includes adidas, Coca-Cola (TCCC), DELL, Hasbro, Mars, NBC Universal, P&G, Richemont, Shell, Sony, Uber and Walgreens Boots Alliance. To find out more about MediaCom visit us here: www.mediacom.com ACCOUNT OVERVIEW Want to help grow a dynamic, global advertiser at the intersection of digital, data, and mobility? Interested in working for a client rapidly expanding across countries and categories with services benefitting all consumers?  Enjoy a constructive debate and not just being an “order taker?” Keen to build and grow a global team aspiring to be THE destination multinational account at MediaCom? When we’d love to talk to you for a role on Team Uber at MediaCom! MediaCom was recently awarded the global AOR assignment for Uber. Our role is to help the Uber business grow and “glocalize” the future of Media: ensure its local and global team members are integrating and connecting with agility,and delivering best-in-class marketing experiences to its consumers across its growing range of businesses. To serve Uber’s needs, we are creating a bespoke solution with the best of WPP for Uber – accelerate.  accelerate is the opportunity to build what will be MediaCom’s model in a few years.  Joining the team provides you with regional CEO & Global Exco Exposure, a start up experience in a large global company and rapid career advancement within our organization. With 30 countries, +200 plus team members, and regular new product launches, the account is looking for a Regional planning manager to support this complexity with high organization, collaboration, and agility, inspiring markets to be bold and be active participants on the Team Uber community. OVERVIEW OF ROLE: The Regional Planning manager is responsible for responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing the digital strategy for Uber client across all APAC markets. You will participate in monitoring and evaluation on the effectiveness of different media channels.  You will also work together with the offshore execution team and local Mediacom teams for all day-to-day media planning and client service activities associated with assigned accounts. The role requires collaboration with many stakeholders in planning, analytics and investment, across many levels, in a highly matrixed organization.  In this capacity the Regional Planning manager must be able to manage the many projects we balance. Working with the team’s regional leadership, you will help the team accomplish challenging goals and objectives, balancing client, company, and team priorities. YOUR KNOWLEDGE & ABILITIES: Strong digital foundation Google AdWords Certification OR Facebook blueprint certification be fully conversant with digital media and able to think across the whole media mix have broad cross-channel digital knowledge Experience working with multiple stakeholders (e.g. suppliers, advertising/marketing agencies, media owners and internal specialist resources) Extensive knowledge of global industry trends, consumer trends, promotional resources, market status, and competition be a strong communicator – English is our global language Solid understanding of interactive research tools Understanding of the principles of marketing and advertising, as well as media concepts and terms, creative and budget requirements Able to understand media data sources in terms of what is measured, the method, and information reported Must possess strong written, presentation, analytical, quantitative, and verbal skills YOUR QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree preferred, advanced degree a plus At least 4-6 years’ experience in Digital planning or execution About MediaCom Welcome innovators, initiative takers and instigators. Founded in 1986 and established in Japan for over 10 years, we have grown to become 8,500 of the world’s leading media communications specialists, in 125 offices, across 100 countries. We are proud to be recognised as the Japan Media Agency of the Year in both 2017 and 2018 with a Silver Award in 2019. With clients including Adidas, Mars, SK-II, Dell, The Coca-Cola Corporation, Cartier, IKEA, Peugeot and Citroen, working at MediaCom is a gateway to working with leading global brand organisations and connecting to people across the planet. But the real secret to our success is simple (and not really a secret). It’s our People First, Better Results philosophy. Our focus is on providing long term, rewarding careers and we know that when we invest in our people, we’ll deliver better results not only for them, but also for our clients. We also know that talent comes in all shapes, sizes, genders and ethnicities. That’s why our agencies are open environments that celebrate difference and have built in flexibility that reflects the many different ways in which people work and succeed. And its why we actively encourage participation in our Global Mobility programme with opportunities to live and work around the world. We are super connected and our employees contribute to and shape the working environment, from promoting work-life balance and well-being to organising team events and celebrations. Do you want to work with smart, creative, connected and enthusiastic people in a stable and rewarding environment? So do we. Welcome to MediaCom. About GroupM Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Job_Title: Mediacom | Regional Strategy Director Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at MediaCom The Role: This is a fantastic opportunity to work on the account of one of the biggest advertisers in the world. MediaCom have been working with the client for decades and have developed a close relationship with this multi-national company. The Regional Strategy Director is a critical role in providing regional brand strategy and solutions across the AMA region. This role is the vital cog between the brand VP’s and local market client teams to deliver effective and aligned brand strategy and solutions. The candidate in the role will effectively leverage their extensive experience and media knowledge, coupled with their growing understanding of client issues and challenges, to drive innovative thinking and thought leadership into brand solutions across the region. Your Impact: Direct, develop/oversee regional brand planning objectives strategies and solutions that coincide with the client’s marketing direction Collaborate with client VP’s, brand directors and local market planning teams to deliver effective brand solutions Use extensive knowledge of the media landscape and knowledge of the client needs to lead on presenting innovative ideas and concepts Bring thought leadership to the way we design and deliver brand plans. Ensure the key strategic elements of high-priority media plans deliver against business results Foster a culture of agility, speed, and innovation and work collaboratively with local planning and strategy teams which creates alignment for the client brands. Leverage inputs from various disciplines to provide insight-driven recommendations and POVs Inspire and support the team through strong leadership, collaboration, and mentorship Establish solid, credible relationships with key Client and MediaCom stakeholders Skills, Behaviours and experience required: Strategic Skills Extensive understanding of client business issues, industry trends, consumer trends, promotional resources, market status, and competition Complete knowledge of all aspects of media/ brand planning Demonstrable strong strategic planning and implementation skills and experience Extensive experience within a senior planning position, preferably in a regional or multi market role Able to make complex decisions; able to create the new and different; understands the business and creating opportunity from such knowledge Strong analytical skills to identify consumer journey planning Client Account Management XX+ years of senior management experience Evidence of being able to influence and manage senior client stakeholders (media managers, marketing directors and country heads) Strong customer relationship management experience and proven ability in developing senior customer stakeholder relationships Able to set clear goals and objectives to support and team the progress of planning and achievement for local markets against regional plans People management Demonstrable people management experience gained within a matrix management structure and specifically capability at developing and sharing knowledge and developing team(s) and resource capabilities Ensure individuals workloads are managed and prioritised in line with client needs and SLA’s Commercial A track record of improving client profitability through both strategy and operational delivery Evidence of strong collaboration skills used to develop team and client knowledge in order to grow shared understanding and knowledge to facilitate a step-change in strategic planning About Mediacom MediaCom unleashes brands’ growth by helping them See the Bigger Picture. We know that by investing in our people’s whole-person wellbeing, careers and capabilities, we will help grow our clients’ businesses. In 2021 this approach led MediaCom to be crowned Global Media Network of the Year by Adweek and Festival of Media Global, in addition to being Eurobest’s current Media Network of the Year and the most awarded agency at the WARC Media Awards. MediaCom is one of the world’s leading media communications specialists, with billings of US$17.6 billion (Source: COMvergence, 2020), employing 8,000 people in 125 offices across 100 countries. Its global client roster includes adidas, Coca-Cola (TCCC), Dell, Hasbro, Mars, NBC Universal, P&G, Richemont, Shell, Sony, Uber and Walgreens Boots Alliance. Job_Title: Event Marketing Manager, Amazon Global Selling
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon Global Selling is one of Amazon's business units that helps businesses from anywhere in the world to launch a global business, reaching Amazon customers around the world and building international brands. Through Amazon Global Selling, sellers of different types and s can directly reach Amazon's 300+ million worldwide active customer accounts, including 150 million+ Prime customers in overseas Amazon marketplaces and millions of institutional buyers. We are hiring a strategic and experienced event marketing lead to manage the highly visible mega events for Amazon Global Selling Singapore and Malaysia. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting growing business. In this role, you will own the strategy and execution of annual mega events targeting cross-border e-commerce decision makers in South East Asia. You will leverage industry trends and Seller insights to guide the event content and productions, and ensure virtual, hybrid and offline event experience for target audiences. You will work closely with business/sales teams and cross functions to plan and execute events to meet the goals. The ideal candidate is a self-driven marketer with proven record of planning and executing highly impactful large-scaled events. You should have a hands-on approach with your event management style, and possess excellent project management skills. This position is based in Singapore. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Key job responsibilities . Manage event marketing goals and experience for Singapore and Malaysia selling partners . Manage event budget, results tracking and analysis, and overall event timeline . Influence and align event strategies and plans with business priorities across stakeholder groups, including interfacing directly with leadership and business/sales teams. . Manage end to end planning and execution of events with operational and logistical excellence build processes for repeatable and scalable event activities . Work with multi-layer stakeholders and external agencies to manage event content and production, speaker selection, agenda, and overall event experience with a Seller-obsessed mindset . Develop and execute event marketing plans that achieves marketing and shared goals (registrations and attendees, event views, sponsorship etc) BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . 6+ years experience in event management and marketing with increasing levels of responsibilities . Proved record of building and executing high-impact events (>2K+ offline attendees) in South East Asia . An ambitious self-starter with excellent follow-through skills to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast and dynamic environment. . Skilled negotiator with proven experience in finding creative ways to do more with less and staying within budget . Excellent verbal and written communication skills capable to clearly present ideas to the senior executives and across organization . Stay abreast of the latest event tools and trends be open to new ideas and drive innovation PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Capability to move easily between generating big, strategic ideas, and driving hands-on process improvement along with team . Ability to identify better ways of working at scale through building new mechanisms and processes . Proactive approach to handling any challenges that might arise and ability to quickly troubleshoot any problems that should arise on the event day . Collaborative attitude and ability to stay calm under pressure . Strong judgment and decision-making skills . Capable of confidently using experience and data to assess and recommend the best course of action even in ambiguous situations . A self-starter who can take general direction and produce specific results . E-commerce industry knowledge and experience preferred . Project management experience . International experience . Good oral and written communication in another language in South East Asia . Demonstrates Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role.
